<EFX_PROCEED_USE>
<A NAME="FIS_PROCEED_USE"></A>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
<A NAME="A2230336ZS-1_HTM_CS46701_USE_OF_PROCEEDS">
</A>
<A NAME="A2230336ZS-1_HTM_TOC_CS46701_2">
</A>
<BR>
</FONT>
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
<B>
	USE OF PROCEEDS
<BR>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	We estimate that the net proceeds that we will receive in this public offering will be approximately $&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;million, or approximately
	$&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;million if the underwriters exercise their option in full to purchase additional shares from us, after the underwriting discounts and commissions and estimated
	offering
	expenses payable by us.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	We
	intend to use the net proceeds primarily to expand our sales, marketing, reimbursement, clinical, regulatory and product development activities, and the remainder for working capital, general and
	administrative expenses and other general corporate purposes. We may also use a portion of our net proceeds to acquire or invest in complementary products, technologies or businesses, although we have
	no present commitments to complete any such transaction. The amounts and timing of our expenditures will depend on numerous factors, including the rate of adoption of our devices, the expenses we
	incur in sales and marketing our devices, the scope of research and development efforts, the timing and success of any clinical trials we may commence in the future, and the timing of regulatory
	submissions.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	Accordingly,
	our management will have broad discretion over the use of the net proceeds from this offering. Pending the uses described above, we intend to invest the net proceeds in short-term,
	interest-bearing, investment-grade securities, certificates of deposit or governmental securities.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	An
	increase (decrease) of 100,000 shares from the expected number of shares to be sold by us in this offering, assuming no change in the assumed public offering price per share, and after deducting
	the estimated underwriting discount and estimated offering expenses payable by us, would increase (decrease) our net proceeds from this offering by approximately $&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;million. A
	$1.00 increase (decrease) in the assumed public offering price would increase (decrease) our expected net proceeds by approximately $&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;million, assuming the number of shares
	offered by us, as set forth on the cover page of this prospectus, remains the same and after deducting the estimated underwriting discount and estimated offering expenses payable by us.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	We
	will not receive any proceeds from the sale of shares of our common stock in this offering by the selling stockholders, which include certain members of our management and Board of Directors. For
	more information about the selling stockholders, see "Principal and Selling Stockholders."
</FONT>
</P>
</EFX_PROCEED_USE>
<EFX_MARKET>

	trading market for our common stock. Our common stock priced at $10.00 per share in our IPO on July&nbsp;27, 2016. The following table sets forth for the periods indicated the high and low intra-day
	sale prices per share of our common stock as reported on the NASDAQ Global Market:

<EFX_DIVIDEND_POLICY>

<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">

<A NAME="A2230336ZS-1_HTM_CS46701_DIVIDEND_POLICY">

<A NAME="A2230336ZS-1_HTM_TOC_CS46701_3">
</A>
<BR>
</FONT>
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
<B>
	DIVIDEND POLICY
<BR>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	We have never declared or paid any cash dividends on our common stock. We intend to retain our future earnings, if any, to finance the operation and expansion
	of our business. We do not expect to pay cash dividends on our common stock in the foreseeable future. Payment of future cash dividends, if any, will be at the discretion of our board of directors
	after taking into account various factors, including our financial condition, operating results, current and anticipated cash needs, outstanding indebtedness and plans for expansion and restrictions
	imposed by lenders, if any.
</FONT>
</P>

<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-9PT;'>
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=1>
<SUP>
	(1)
</SUP>
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=1>
	A
	$1.00 increase (decrease) in the assumed public offering price of $&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;per share, which was the closing price of our common stock as reported on NASDAQ
	on&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;, 2016, would increase (decrease) additional paid-in capital and total stockholders' equity by approximately $&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;million,
	assuming the number of shares offered by
	us remains the same as set forth on the cover page of this prospectus and after deducting the estimated underwriting discount and estimated offering expenses payable by us. An increase (decrease) of
	100,000 shares from the expected number of shares to be sold by us in this offering, assuming no change in the assumed public offering price of $&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;per share, which was the
	closing price
	of our common stock as reported on NASDAQ on&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;, 2016, would increase (decrease) additional paid-in capital and total stockholders' equity by approximately
	$&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;million
	after deducting the estimated underwriting discount and estimated offering expenses payable by us.
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>

	The
	table and calculations above are based on the adjustments set forth above.

<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
<B>
	SELECTED CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL DATA
<BR>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	The following tables set forth our selected historical consolidated financial data as of and for the periods indicated. The selected consolidated statements
	of operations data for the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2014 and 2015, and the selected consolidated balance sheet data as of December&nbsp;31, 2014 and 2015, have been derived from our audited
	consolidated financial statements included elsewhere in this prospectus. Our selected consolidated statements of operations data for the nine months ended September&nbsp;30, 2015 and 2016, and the
	selected consolidated balance sheet data as of September&nbsp;30, 2016, have been derived from our unaudited interim consolidated financial statements included elsewhere in this prospectus. We have
	prepared the unaudited interim consolidated financial statements on the same basis as the audited consolidated financial statements and have included, in our opinion, all adjustments, consisting only
	of normal recurring adjustments that we consider necessary for a fair statement of financial statements set forth in those statements. Our historical results are not indicative of the results to be
	expected in the future and our interim results are not necessarily indicative of results to be expected for the full year ended December&nbsp;31, 2016, or any other period. The following financial
	data should be read in conjunction with, and are qualified in their entirety by reference to, "Use of Proceeds," "Capitalization," "Management's Discussion and Analysis of Financial
	Condition and Results of Operations" and our financial statements and the related notes included elsewhere in this prospectus.
</FONT>

<!-- COMMAND=ADD_LINERULETXT,NOSHADE COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE="1.0PT" WIDTH="39%" ALIGN="LEFT" -->
<HR NOSHADE COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE="1.0PT" WIDTH="39%" ALIGN="LEFT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="PADDING:0PT;POSITION:RELATIVE;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;MARGIN-LEFT:10%;">
<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-9PT;'>
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=1>
<SUP>
	(1)
</SUP>
</FONT>
</DT>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=1>
	Net
	income (loss) per common share attributable to common stockholders is calculated under the two-class method, as our convertible preferred stock participated in
	the undistributed earnings of the company prior to the IPO. The two-class method requires earnings for the period to be allocated based upon their respective rights to receive distributed and
	undistributed earnings. No adjustment is made during periods with a net loss, as the holders of the convertible preferred stock have no obligation to fund losses.
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>
</DIV>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	64
</FONT>
</P>

<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>

</EFX_FINANCIAL_DATA>
<EFX_MANAGEMENTS_DISCUSSION>
<A NAME="FIS_MANAGEMENTS_DISCUSSION"></A>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
<A NAME="A2230336ZS-1_HTM_CW46701_MANAGEMENT_S_DISCUSSION_AND_AN__MAN03466">
</A>
<A NAME="A2230336ZS-1_HTM_TOC_CW46701_1">
</A>
<BR>
</FONT>
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
<B>
	MANAGEMENT'S DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS OF
<BR>
	FINANCIAL CONDITION AND RESULTS OF OPERATIONS
<BR>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
<I>
	The following discussion and analysis of our financial condition and results of operations should be read in conjunction with the
	Selected Consolidated Financial Data and our consolidated financial statements and the accompanying notes thereto included elsewhere in this prospectus. Our actual results could differ materially from
	those anticipated in the forward-looking statements included in this discussion as a result of certain factors, including, but not limited to, those discussed in "Risk Factors" and "Special Note
	Regarding Forward-Looking Statements" included elsewhere in this prospectus.
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Overview
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	We are a medical technology company that develops and provides innovative medical devices for the treatment of chronic diseases at home. We focus on advancing
	the standard of care in treating chronic diseases in the home setting to improve patient outcomes and quality of life and help control rising healthcare expenditures. We possess a unique, scalable
	platform to deliver at-home healthcare solutions throughout the United States. This evolving home care delivery model is recognized by policy-makers and payers as a key for controlling rising
	healthcare expenditures. Our initial area of therapeutic focus is vascular disease, with a goal of advancing the standard of care in treating lymphedema and chronic venous insufficiency. Our solutions
	deliver cost-effective, clinically proven, long-term treatment for these chronic diseases.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	Our
	proprietary products are the Flexitouch System, the Entr&eacute; System and the ACTitouch System. A predecessor to our Flexitouch System received 510(k) clearance from the FDA in July
	2002, and we introduced the system to address the many limitations of self-administered home-based manual lymphatic drainage therapy. We began selling our more advanced Flexitouch System after
	receiving 510(k) clearance from the FDA in October 2006. In September 2016, we received 510(k) clearance from the FDA for the Flexitouch System in treating lymphedema in the head and neck.
	Historically, we derived substantially all of our revenues from our Flexitouch System. For the nine months ended September&nbsp;30, 2016 and 2015, sales of our Flexitouch System represented 86% and
	87% of our revenues, respectively.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	In
	September 2012, we acquired our second proprietary product, the ACTitouch System. The system received 510(k) clearance from the FDA in June 2013, and we began selling the product in September 2013
	to address the many limitations of non-removable multilayered bandages that are worn by patients suffering from venous leg&nbsp;ulcers. We also introduced our Entr&eacute; System in the
	United States in February 2013. The Entr&eacute; System is sold to patients who need a more basic pump or who do not yet qualify for insurance reimbursement for an advanced compression device
	such as our Flexitouch System. For the nine months ended September&nbsp;30, 2016 and 2015, sales of our ACTitouch and Entr&eacute; Systems combined represented 14% and 13% of our revenues,
	respectively.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	To
	support the growth of our business, we invest heavily in our commercial infrastructure, consisting of our direct sales force, home training resources, reimbursement capabilities and clinical
	expertise. We market our products in the United States using a direct-to-patient and -provider model. Our direct sales force has grown from three representatives in March 2005 to a team of over 110
	people as of September&nbsp;30, 2016. This model allows us to directly approach patients and clinicians, whereby we disintermediate the traditional durable medical equipment channel, allowing us to
	capture both the manufacturer and distributor margins. We also utilize over 300 licensed, independent healthcare practitioners as home trainers who educate patients on the proper use of our systems.
	We invest substantial resources in our reimbursement operations group of over 65 people that focuses on verifying case-by-case benefits, obtaining prior authorization, billing and collecting payments
	from payers and providing customer support services. Our payer relations group of over 25 people is
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	65
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE COLOR="#5D6E7E">
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=1,SEQ=70,EFW="2230336",CP="TACTILE SYSTEMS TECHNOLOGY INC.",DN="1",CHK=340717,FOLIO='65',FILE='DISK108:[16ZCR1.16ZCR46701]CW46701A.;8',USER='PANDERS',CD='21-NOV-2016;19:05' -->
<A NAME="A2230336ZS-1_HTM_PAGE_CW46701_1_66">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2230336ZS-1_HTM_BG46701A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	responsible
	for developing relationships with payer decision-makers to educate them on our product efficacy, develop overall payer coverage policies and reimbursement criteria, manage Medicare patient
	claims and contracts with payers, and serve as an advocacy liaison between patients, clinicians and payers throughout the appeals process. We also have a clinical team, consisting of a scientific
	advisory board, in-house therapists and nurses, and a medical director (part-time), that serves as a resource to clinicians and patients and guides our development of clinical evidence in support of
	our products.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	Our
	patients are reimbursed by government and private payers for the purchase of our products pursuant to established rates with each payer. We rely on third-party contract manufacturers for the
	sourcing of parts, the assembly of our controllers and the manufacturing of the garments used with our systems. We conduct final assembly of the garments used with our Flexitouch System, perform
	quality assurance, and ship our products from our facility in Minneapolis, Minnesota.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	For
	the nine months ended September&nbsp;30, 2016, we generated revenues of $56.1&nbsp;million and had net income of $0.5&nbsp;million, compared to revenues of $41.7&nbsp;million and net
	income of $0.1&nbsp;million for the nine months ended September&nbsp;30, 2015.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	For
	the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015, we generated revenues of $62.9&nbsp;million and had net income of $1.4&nbsp;million, compared to revenues of $47.7&nbsp;million and net income of
	$2.1&nbsp;million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	Our
	primary sources of capital to date have been from operating income and private placements of our capital stock, as well as our initial public offering, which closed on August&nbsp;2, 2016. We
	operate in one segment for financial reporting purposes.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Components of our Results of Operations
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Revenues
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	We derive our revenues from the sale of our Flexitouch, ACTitouch and Entr&eacute; systems to patients in the United States. Revenue growth has been
	driven by increased clinician, patient and payer awareness of lymphedema and the clinical efficacy of our Flexitouch System, and launch of our ACTitouch and Entr&eacute; systems in 2013. We
	have expanded our direct sales force that helps us drive and support our revenue growth and intend to continue this expansion. However, any reversal in these recent trends could have a negative impact
	on our future revenues.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	Our
	revenues have fluctuated, and we expect our revenues to continue to fluctuate, from quarter to quarter due to a variety of factors. For instance, our fourth quarter tends to be our strongest
	quarter of the year. See "&#151;&nbsp;Seasonality" for a further discussion of factors contributing to seasonality. Further, our revenues are impacted by fluctuations in the mix of products
	being sold during each period and changes in the mix of our payers.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	We
	sell our products directly to patients, who are referred to us by physicians, therapists or nurses. We bill payers, such as private insurers, Medicare, the Veterans Administration or Medicaid, on
	behalf of our patients and bill patients directly for their cost-sharing amounts, including any portion of an unsatisfied deductible and any copayments or co-insurance. Approximately 13% of our
	revenues in 2015 and 13% of our revenues in the nine months ended September&nbsp;30, 2016, came from Medicare patients. A recent change to the level of Medicare coverage for our products could
	reduce the number of Medicare patients who have access to our products, and we are seeking to have the coverage determination overturned. Our products currently are not subject to the competitive
	bidding process for supplying covered items to Medicare recipients.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	66
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE COLOR="#5D6E7E">
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=2,SEQ=71,EFW="2230336",CP="TACTILE SYSTEMS TECHNOLOGY INC.",DN="1",CHK=1041469,FOLIO='66',FILE='DISK108:[16ZCR1.16ZCR46701]CW46701A.;8',USER='PANDERS',CD='21-NOV-2016;19:05' -->
<A NAME="A2230336ZS-1_HTM_PAGE_CW46701_1_67">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2230336ZS-1_HTM_BG46701A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	We
	expect our revenues to continue to increase in the future as a result of increased awareness of our solutions, expansion of our direct sales force, marketing and customer support efforts, continued
	focus on developing clinical and economic outcome data, expanded third-party reimbursement and introduction of our solutions outside the United States.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Cost of Goods Sold and Gross Margin
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	Cost of goods sold consists primarily of component costs, direct labor, overhead costs, product warranties, provisions for slow-moving and obsolete inventory
	and delivery costs for items sold. A significant portion of our cost of goods sold consists of manufacturing overhead costs. These overhead costs include the cost of quality assurance, material
	procurement, inventory control, facilities, equipment and operations supervision and management. We expect overhead costs as a percentage of revenues to decrease as a result of expected increases in
	production volume and yields. Cost of goods sold also includes depreciation expense for product tooling, production equipment and shipping costs. We expect cost of goods sold to increase in absolute
	dollars primarily if, and to the extent, our revenues grow.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	We
	provide a warranty on our devices ranging from one to two years for the controller, and one year for the garment. We establish a reserve for warranty repairs based on historical warranty repair
	costs incurred. Provisions for warranty obligations, which are included in cost of goods sold, are recorded at the time of shipment.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	We
	calculate gross margin as gross profit divided by revenues. Our gross margin has been and will continue to be affected by a variety of factors, including product and payer mix, production volumes,
	manufacturing costs and cost-reduction strategies. We expect our gross margin to decrease slightly over the near term as we increase the percentage of total revenues from our ACTitouch and
	Entr&eacute; systems. However, our gross margin will likely fluctuate from quarter to quarter.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Sales and Marketing Expenses
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	Our sales and marketing expenses support our direct-to-patient and -provider model. These expenses consist primarily of personnel-related expenses, including
	salaries, bonuses, commissions and benefits for employees. They also include expenses for patient home training, social media and advertising, informational kits, public relations and other
	promotional and marketing activities, field sales travel and entertainment expenses, trade shows and conferences, stock-based compensation, as well as customer service. We expect sales and marketing
	expenses to continue to increase in absolute dollars as we expand our commercial infrastructure to drive and support our planned revenue growth. To the extent our revenues grow, we expect sales and
	marketing expenses to decrease as a percentage of revenues over time.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Research and Development Expenses
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	Research and development, or R&amp;D, expenses consist primarily of personnel-related expenses, third-party product development costs, laboratory supplies,
	consulting fees and related costs, clinical research expenses, expenses related to clinical and regulatory affairs, patent amortization costs, stock-based compensation and patent legal fees, including
	defense costs and testing costs for new product launches. Clinical research expenses include clinical trial management and monitoring, payment to clinical investigators, consulting fees, data
	management, stock-based compensation, travel expenses and the cost of manufacturing products for clinical trials. We have made substantial investments in R&amp;D since our inception. Our R&amp;D efforts have
	focused primarily on activities designed to enhance our technologies and to support development and commercialization of new and existing products. We expect R&amp;D expenses to increase in absolute
	dollars for the foreseeable future as we continue to
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	67
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE COLOR="#5D6E7E">
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=3,SEQ=72,EFW="2230336",CP="TACTILE SYSTEMS TECHNOLOGY INC.",DN="1",CHK=717547,FOLIO='67',FILE='DISK108:[16ZCR1.16ZCR46701]CW46701A.;8',USER='PANDERS',CD='21-NOV-2016;19:05' -->
<A NAME="A2230336ZS-1_HTM_PAGE_CW46701_1_68">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2230336ZS-1_HTM_BG46701A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	develop,
	enhance and commercialize new products and expand clinical trial efforts. We expect R&amp;D expenses as a percentage of our revenues to vary over time depending on the level and timing of
	initiating new product development efforts, as well as our clinical trial activities.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Reimbursement, General and Administrative Expenses
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	Reimbursement, general and administrative expenses consist primarily of compensation, including salaries, bonuses and benefits for employees in our patient
	services and advocacy, billing and collections, case management, payer relations and governmental affairs and reimbursement operations departments, as well as finance, human resources and
	administration, information technology, business development and general management functions, and facilities costs. Our experienced reimbursement operations department of over 65 people focuses on
	verifying case-by-case benefits, obtaining prior authorization, billing and collecting payments from payers and providing customer support services. Reimbursement operations department expenses also
	include consulting, travel to payer case manager seminars, professional development and training and certification expenses. General and administrative expenses also include professional services,
	such as legal, consulting and accounting services, stock-based compensation, travel expenses and insurance costs. We expect to incur additional legal, accounting, insurance and other professional
	service fees associated with being a public company, which may increase further when we are no longer able to rely on the "emerging growth company" exemption we are afforded under the JOBS Act. We
	expect
	our reimbursement, general and administrative expenses to increase in absolute dollars, but decrease as a percentage of our revenues, to the extent our revenues grow.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Other Income (Expense), Net
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	Other income (expense), net consists primarily of interest expense related to our notes payable and interest income driven by the interest accruing on cash
	and past due insurance balances. We do not accrue interest on a majority of past due customer accounts receivable balances.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Income Tax Expense (Benefit)
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	Our income tax expense (benefit) consists primarily of deferred income taxes resulting from temporary differences between the reporting of amounts for
	financial statement purposes and income tax purposes.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	68
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE COLOR="#5D6E7E">
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>

<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Results of Operations
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">

<B>

</I>
</B>

</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">

</FONT>

</B>
</FONT>
</TH>
<TH STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=1>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TH>
<TH COLSPAN=5 ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;BORDER-BOTTOM:SOLID #5D6E7E 1.0PT;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=1>
<B>
	Change
</B>

</DIV>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Revenues
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	Revenues increased $14.4&nbsp;million, or 34%, to $56.1&nbsp;million in the nine months ended September&nbsp;30, 2016, compared to $41.7&nbsp;million
	in the nine months ended September&nbsp;30, 2015. The growth in revenues was primarily attributable to an increase of approximately $11.9&nbsp;million, or 33%, in sales of our Flexitouch System in
	the nine months ended September&nbsp;30, 2016 compared to the same prior year period. This increase in Flexitouch sales was driven primarily by expansion of our sales force, increased physician and
	patient awareness of the lymphedema condition, and increased contractual coverage with national and regional insurance payers.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	69
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE COLOR="#5D6E7E">
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>

</DIV>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Cost of Goods Sold and Gross Margin
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	Cost of goods sold increased $3.6&nbsp;million, or 30%, to $15.4&nbsp;million during the nine months ended September&nbsp;30, 2016, compared to
	$11.8&nbsp;million during the nine months ended September&nbsp;30, 2015. The increase in cost of goods sold was primarily attributable to an increase in the number of systems sold.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	Gross
	margin for the nine months ended September&nbsp;30, 2016 increased to 73% compared to 72% for the nine months ended September&nbsp;30, 2015. The year-over-year changes in gross margin was
	primarily due to changes in payer and product mix.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Sales and Marketing Expenses
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	Sales and marketing expenses increased $6.6&nbsp;million, or 38%, to $23.9&nbsp;million during the nine months ended September&nbsp;30, 2016, compared
	to $17.3&nbsp;million during the nine months ended September&nbsp;30, 2015. The increase was primarily attributable to a $4.7&nbsp;million increase in compensation and related expenses as a
	result of increased sales and marketing headcount. In addition, other sales and marketing expenses increased $1.3&nbsp;million in the nine months ended September&nbsp;30, 2016 over the same prior
	year period primarily due to increased field sales meetings, travel and entertainment, consulting and field sales training expenses.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Research and Development Expenses
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	R&amp;D expenses increased $0.4&nbsp;million, or 13%, to $3.3&nbsp;million during the nine months ended September&nbsp;30, 2016, compared to
	$2.9&nbsp;million during the nine months ended September&nbsp;30, 2015. The increase in R&amp;D expenses was primarily attributable to increased product development and clinical study costs.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Reimbursement, General and Administrative Expenses
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	Reimbursement, general and administrative expenses increased $3.0&nbsp;million, or 32%, to $12.5&nbsp;million during the nine months ended
	September&nbsp;30, 2016, compared to $9.5&nbsp;million during the nine months ended September&nbsp;30, 2015. The increase in reimbursement, general and administrative expenses was primarily
	attributable to personnel-related expenses as a result of increased headcount in our patient services, contracting, case management, billing and collections, advocacy, reimbursement and administrative
	teams, as well as higher facility costs for rent, utilities, property taxes and maintenance.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	70
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE COLOR="#5D6E7E">
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>

</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Other Income, Net
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	Other income, net, was $20,000 and $18,000 during the nine months ended September&nbsp;30, 2016 and 2015, respectively.
</FONT>
</P>

<!-- COMMAND=ADD_LINERULETXT,NOSHADE COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE="1.0PT" WIDTH="39%" ALIGN="LEFT" -->
<HR NOSHADE COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE="1.0PT" WIDTH="39%" ALIGN="LEFT">
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=1>
	*Not meaningful.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Revenues
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	Revenues increased $15.1&nbsp;million, or 32%, to $62.9&nbsp;million during the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015, compared to $47.7&nbsp;million
	during the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014. The growth in revenues was primarily attributable to an increase of approximately $11.0&nbsp;million, or 25%, in sales of our Flexitouch System, an
	increase of approximately $0.9&nbsp;million, or 37%, in sales of our ACTitouch System, and an increase of approximately $3.2&nbsp;million, or 198%, in sales of our Entr&eacute; System. The
	increase in unit sales of our Flexitouch System was driven by expansion of our sales force and increased physician and patient awareness. The increase in unit sales of our ACTitouch System was due to
	continued penetration of wound clinics, particularly within Veterans Administration hospitals.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	71
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE COLOR="#5D6E7E">
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>

</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Cost of Goods Sold and Gross Margin
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	Cost of goods sold increased $4.2&nbsp;million, or 33%, to $16.9&nbsp;million during the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015, compared to
	$12.7&nbsp;million during the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014. The increase in cost of goods sold was primarily attributable to an increase in the number of systems sold, partially offset by
	reduced material and labor costs for our products associated with better sourcing and increased volumes.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	Gross
	margin for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 of 73.1% was essentially flat compared to gross margin of 73.4% for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Sales and Marketing Expenses
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	Sales and marketing expenses increased $6.3&nbsp;million, or 35%, to $24.5&nbsp;million during the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015, compared to
	$18.2&nbsp;million during the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014. The increase was primarily attributable to a $4.7&nbsp;million increase in personnel-related compensation expenses as a result of
	increased sales and marketing headcount. In addition, other sales and marketing expenses increased $1.6&nbsp;million due to increased field sales travel expenses, trade show and conference expenses
	and patient training costs.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Research and Development Expenses
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	R&amp;D expenses increased $1.5&nbsp;million, or 52%, to $4.3&nbsp;million during the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015, compared to $2.8&nbsp;million
	during the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014. The increase in R&amp;D expenses was primarily attributable to increases in product development and consulting costs of $1.2&nbsp;million and clinical
	study costs of $0.2&nbsp;million.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Reimbursement, General and Administrative Expenses
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	Reimbursement, general and administrative expenses increased $3.5&nbsp;million, or 34%, to $13.7&nbsp;million during the year ended December&nbsp;31,
	2015, compared to $10.2&nbsp;million during the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014. The increase in reimbursement, general and administrative expenses was primarily attributable to a
	$1.7&nbsp;million increase in personnel-related expenses as a result of increased headcount on our patient services, contracting, case management, billing and collections, advocacy, reimbursement
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	72
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE COLOR="#5D6E7E">
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=4,SEQ=77,EFW="2230336",CP="TACTILE SYSTEMS TECHNOLOGY INC.",DN="1",CHK=92019,FOLIO='72',FILE='DISK108:[16ZCR1.16ZCR46701]CY46701A.;19',USER='PANDERS',CD='21-NOV-2016;19:05' -->
<A NAME="A2230336ZS-1_HTM_PAGE_CY46701_1_73">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2230336ZS-1_HTM_BG46701A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	and
	administrative teams, an increase of $1.0&nbsp;million in professional, legal, accounting and information technology costs, and higher facility costs of $0.2&nbsp;million for new office space,
	utilities, property taxes and maintenance.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Other Expense
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	Other expense increased to $0.2&nbsp;million during the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 due primarily to interest expense recognized on minimum royalty
	payments. Other expense was less than $5,000 during the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Quarterly Results of Operations Data
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	The following table sets forth our unaudited quarterly statements of consolidated operations data and other data for each of the eight most recent quarters in
	the period ended September&nbsp;30, 2016. We have prepared the quarterly results of operations data on a consistent basis with the audited consolidated financial statements included elsewhere in
	this prospectus. In the opinion of management, the quarterly results of operations data reflect all necessary adjustments, consisting only of normal recurring adjustments, necessary for a fair
	statement of this data. The statements of consolidated operations data should be read in conjunction with the consolidated financial statements and related notes included elsewhere in this prospectus.
	The results of historical periods are not necessarily indicative of results for a full year or for any future period.
</FONT>
</P>

<TH STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">

<!-- END OF USER-SPECIFIED TAGGED TABLE -->
</DIV>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Seasonality
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	Our business may be affected by seasonality. In the first quarter of each year, when most patients have started a new insurance year and have not paid their
	annual insurance deductibles, we experience substantially reduced demand for our products. We typically experience higher sales in the third and fourth quarters as a result of patients having paid
	their annual insurance deductibles in full, thereby reducing their out-of-pocket costs for our products, or because patients often spend the remaining balances in their flexible-spending accounts.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	73
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE COLOR="#5D6E7E">
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>

<A NAME="A2230336ZS-1_HTM_PAGE_CY46701_1_74">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2230336ZS-1_HTM_BG46701A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<EFX_LIQUIDITY>
<A NAME="FIS_LIQUIDITY"></A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Liquidity and Capital Resources
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Overview
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	As of September&nbsp;30, 2016, we had cash and cash equivalents of $39.3&nbsp;million and an accumulated deficit of $5.2&nbsp;million, compared to cash
	and cash equivalents of $7.1&nbsp;million and an accumulated deficit of $5.7&nbsp;million as of December&nbsp;31, 2015.
</FONT>
</P>
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_17"></A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Cash Flows
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	The following table summarizes our cash flows for the periods indicated:
</FONT>
</P>

<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Net Cash Provided By (Used in) Operating Activities
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	Net cash provided by operating activities during the nine months ended September&nbsp;30, 2016 was $4.3&nbsp;million. This increase in cash provided by
	operations resulted from net
	income of $0.5&nbsp;million, a $1.8&nbsp;million decrease in net operating assets and liabilities, and $2.0&nbsp;million of non-cash expense items. Our net operating assets and liabilities
	decreased $1.8&nbsp;million primarily due to a decrease in accounts receivable and increases in accounts payable, accrued expenses and accrued payroll, offset by payments of product royalties and
	increased inventory purchases. Non-cash expense items of $2.0&nbsp;million primarily consisted of stock-based compensation expense and depreciation and amortization of equipment, leasehold
	improvements, and patents, as well as changes in allowances for doubtful accounts.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	Net
	cash used in operating activities during the nine months ended September&nbsp;30, 2015 was $0.2&nbsp;million. This use of cash was primarily due to net income of $0.1&nbsp;million and
	$1.2&nbsp;million of non-cash expense items, offset by a $1.5&nbsp;million net increase in operating assets and liabilities in the nine-month period ending September&nbsp;30, 2015.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	Net
	cash provided by operating activities during the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 was $1.4&nbsp;million, consisting primarily of our net income of $1.4&nbsp;million, a decrease of
	$0.9&nbsp;million in deferred income tax assets, a $0.1&nbsp;million provision for doubtful accounts and a non-cash expense of $1.1&nbsp;million. The cash provided by operations was primarily
	due to the ongoing commercialization of our products, as well as increased accounts receivable, inventory, prepaid expenses and other non-current assets, offset by increased accounts payable, accrued
	compensation and accrued expenses. The non-cash expense items primarily consisted of depreciation and amortization of equipment and leasehold improvements and patents and stock-based compensation. Our
	net operating assets and liabilities increased $2.1&nbsp;million. The increase in our net operating assets and liabilities was primarily due to increased accounts receivable, inventory, and other
	non-current assets.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	Net
	cash used in operating activities during the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014 was $1.0&nbsp;million, consisting primarily of our net income of $2.1&nbsp;million, a decrease of
	$1.6&nbsp;million in deferred income tax assets, a $0.5&nbsp;million provision for doubtful accounts and a non-cash expense of $0.8&nbsp;million. The
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	74
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE COLOR="#5D6E7E">
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=6,SEQ=79,EFW="2230336",CP="TACTILE SYSTEMS TECHNOLOGY INC.",DN="1",CHK=571512,FOLIO='74',FILE='DISK108:[16ZCR1.16ZCR46701]CY46701A.;19',USER='PANDERS',CD='21-NOV-2016;19:05' -->
<A NAME="A2230336ZS-1_HTM_PAGE_CY46701_1_75">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2230336ZS-1_HTM_BG46701A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	cash
	used in operations was primarily due to the ongoing commercialization of our products, as well as increased accounts receivable and inventory and decreased accrued compensation, offset by
	increased accounts payable. The non-cash expense items primarily consisted of depreciation and amortization of equipment and leasehold improvements and patents and stock-based compensation. Our net
	operating assets and liabilities increased $6.0&nbsp;million. The increase in our net operating assets and liabilities was primarily due to increased accounts receivable and inventory.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Net Cash Used in Investing Activities
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	Net cash used in investing activities during the nine months ended September&nbsp;30, 2016 was $0.5&nbsp;million, consisting primarily of purchases of
	product tooling and computer and manufacturing equipment. Net cash used in investing activities during the nine months ended September&nbsp;30, 2015 was $0.4&nbsp;million, consisting primarily of
	purchases of product tooling and computer and manufacturing equipment.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	Net
	cash used in investing activities during the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015, was $0.6&nbsp;million, consisting of product tooling and computer and manufacturing equipment. Net cash used in
	investing activities during the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014 was $0.4&nbsp;million, consisting of product tooling and computer and manufacturing equipment.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Net Cash Provided by Financing Activities
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	Until August 2016, when we closed on our initial public offering, we historically funded our operations through the issuance of capital stock. Net cash
	provided by financing activities during the nine months ended September&nbsp;30, 2016, was $28.4&nbsp;million, generated by gross proceeds of $41.2&nbsp;million from the initial public offering,
	partially offset by $8.2&nbsp;million in payments of accrued dividends on preferred stock and $4.8&nbsp;million of underwriting discounts and expenses associated with the initial public offering.
	We also paid $1.0&nbsp;million of expenses associated with the initial public offering during the fourth quarter of 2015. Net cash provided by financing activities during the nine months ended
	September&nbsp;30, 2015 was $0.9&nbsp;million, consisting of proceeds from exercise of common stock options and warrants.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	Net
	cash provided by financing activities during the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015, was $0.9&nbsp;million, consisting of proceeds from exercise of common stock options and warrants partially
	offset by minimal repayments of borrowings. Net cash provided by financing activities during the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014 was $0.2&nbsp;million, consisting of proceeds from exercise of
	stock options, partially offset by minimal repayments of borrowings.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Credit Line
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	We have a bank credit line with borrowing availability of $2.0&nbsp;million. As of September&nbsp;30, 2016, we did not have any outstanding borrowings
	under our credit line. Our credit line bears interest based on the prime rate, which was 3.50% as of September&nbsp;30, 2016. On May&nbsp;11, 2016, we extended our credit agreement until
	May&nbsp;11, 2017. Our credit line is secured by substantially all our assets, including property and equipment, accounts receivable and inventory. Our credit line contains customary conditions as
	to borrowing, events of default and covenants, including covenants that restrict our ability to dispose of assets, merge with or acquire other entities, and incur indebtedness or encumbrances.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Off-Balance Sheet Arrangements
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	We did not have during the periods presented, and we do not currently have, any off-balance sheet arrangements, as defined under the applicable regulations.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	75
</FONT>
</P>

<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">

<DIV STYLE="PADDING:0PT;POSITION:RELATIVE;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;MARGIN-LEFT:10%;">
<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-9PT;'>
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=1>
<SUP>
	(1)
</SUP>
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=1>
	We
	currently lease approximately 52,000 square feet of office and assembly space at our corporate headquarters in Minneapolis, Minnesota under a lease
	that expires in July 2021 and an additional 31,200 square feet of office and warehouse space at a second leased facility in Minneapolis, Minnesota under a lease that expires in October 2021.
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-9PT;'>
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=1>
<SUP>
	(2)
</SUP>
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=1>
	We
	are required to make royalty payments to a third party for our ACTitouch System through 2023. We are required to make quarterly payments through
	2023, with guaranteed payments through the third quarter of 2016, and for the remaining period, equal to 6% of our quarterly revenues attributable to our ACTitouch System. In any year that these
	revenues exceed $40.0&nbsp;million, we are required to pay 7% on revenues $40.0&nbsp;million and over and 6% on revenues $40.0&nbsp;million and under.
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-9PT;'>
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=1>
<SUP>
	(3)
</SUP>
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=1>
	Represents
	purchase orders issued in February 2016 to vendors for inventory expected to be received in 2016 and 2017.
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Quantitative and Qualitative Disclosures about Market Risk
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Interest Rate Risk
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	We are exposed to market risk from changes in interest rates, primarily related to our investment activities. The principal objectives of our investment
	activities are to preserve principal, provide liquidity and maximize income consistent with minimizing risk of material loss. The recorded carrying amounts of cash and cash equivalents approximate
	fair value due to their short maturities. Our interest income is sensitive to changes in the general level of interest rates in the United States, particularly since our investments are generally
	short-term in nature. Due to the nature of our short-term investments, an immediate 100 basis point change in interest rates would not have a material effect on the fair market value of our portfolio.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	Additionally,
	the interest rates for our credit line have both fixed and variable components. If overall interest rates had increased by 100 basis points during the periods presented, our interest
	expense would not have been materially affected.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Inflation
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	Inflationary factors, such as increases in our cost of goods sold, sales and marketing expenses and reimbursement expenses, may adversely affect our operating
	results. Although we do not believe that inflation has had a material impact on our financial condition or results of operations to date, a high rate of inflation in the future may have an adverse
	effect on our ability to maintain and increase our gross margin, and on our sales and marketing and reimbursement expenses as a percentage of our revenues if the selling prices of our products do not
	increase as much or more than these increased costs.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Credit Risk
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	As of December&nbsp;31, 2014 and 2015 and September&nbsp;30, 2016, our cash and cash equivalents were maintained with one financial institution in the
	United states and our current deposits are likely in
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	76
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE COLOR="#5D6E7E">
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=1,SEQ=81,EFW="2230336",CP="TACTILE SYSTEMS TECHNOLOGY INC.",DN="1",CHK=928837,FOLIO='76',FILE='DISK108:[16ZCR1.16ZCR46701]DA46701A.;13',USER='PANDERS',CD='21-NOV-2016;19:05' -->
<A NAME="A2230336ZS-1_HTM_PAGE_DA46701_1_77">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2230336ZS-1_HTM_BG46701A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	excess
	of insured limits. We have reviewed the financial statements of this institution and believe it has sufficient assets and liquidity to conduct its operations in the ordinary course of business
	with little or no credit risk to us.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	Our
	accounts receivable primarily relate to revenues from the sale of our products to patients in the United States. For the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014 and 2015 and for the nine months ended
	September&nbsp;30, 2016, our accounts receivable were $15.0&nbsp;million, $16.2&nbsp;million and $14.7&nbsp;million, respectively. We had accounts receivable from three insurance companies
	representing approximately 23%, 12% and 6% of accounts receivable as of September&nbsp;30, 2016 and we had accounts receivable from three insurance companies representing approximately 28%, 20%, and
	5% of accounts receivable as of September&nbsp;30, 2015. We had accounts receivable from three insurance companies representing approximately 26%, 18% and 7% of accounts receivable as of
	December&nbsp;31, 2015 and we had accounts receivable from three insurance companies representing approximately 25%, 24% and 5% of accounts receivable as of December&nbsp;31, 2014.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Foreign Currency Risk
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	Our business is conducted in U.S. dollars and foreign transactions have been minimal. As we begin building relationships to commercialize our products
	internationally, our results of operations and cash flows may become increasingly subject to changes in foreign exchange rates.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Critical Accounting Policies and Significant Estimates
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	Our discussion and analysis of our financial condition and results of operations are based upon our financial statements which have been prepared in
	accordance with generally accepted accounting principles in the United States, or GAAP. The preparation of these financial statements requires us to make estimates and judgments that affect the
	reported amounts of assets and liabilities and related disclosure of contingent assets and liabilities, revenues and expenses at the date of the financial statements. Generally, we base our estimates
	on historical experience and on various other assumptions in accordance with GAAP that we believe to be reasonable under the circumstances. Actual results may differ from these estimates and such
	differences could be material to our financial position and results of operations.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	While
	our significant accounting policies are more fully described in Note&nbsp;1 to our consolidated financial statements included elsewhere in this prospectus, we believe the following discussion
	addresses our most critical accounting policies, which are those that are most important to the portrayal of our financial condition and results of operations and require our most difficult,
	subjective and complex judgments.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Revenue Recognition
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	We recognize revenue when persuasive evidence of a sale arrangement exists, delivery of product has occurred through the transfer of title and risks of reward
	of ownership, the selling price is fixed or determinable and collectability is reasonably assessed.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	We
	distribute our products directly to patients. For any of our products sold to patients covered by private payers, such as commercial insurance companies, we recognize revenues from such sales upon
	shipment of our products. A product is not shipped until we have received a prescription from a physician for our products and, as applicable, receipt of prior authorization from payers. At shipment,
	we invoice the payer for their portion of the total product cost and we recognize revenue as a percentage of the payer's invoice based on the polices and payment history of the applicable payer. The
	payment history of the applicable payer is drawn from our actual payment experience over the last
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	77
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE COLOR="#5D6E7E">
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=2,SEQ=82,EFW="2230336",CP="TACTILE SYSTEMS TECHNOLOGY INC.",DN="1",CHK=846030,FOLIO='77',FILE='DISK108:[16ZCR1.16ZCR46701]DA46701A.;13',USER='PANDERS',CD='21-NOV-2016;19:05' -->
<A NAME="A2230336ZS-1_HTM_PAGE_DA46701_1_78">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2230336ZS-1_HTM_BG46701A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	three
	years. Any differences in payments received as compared to our estimates are recognized in the period for which we actually receive payment for the product. Over time, we adjust the applicable
	estimates used for each payer to reflect any such differences. We separately invoice the patient for their payment obligation with respect to the shipped product, such as copayments and deductibles,
	and recognize revenue upon sending such invoice.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	For
	any of our products sold to Medicare patients, we recognize revenues from such sales upon shipment of our products, which can occur only after we have received a prescription from a physician and
	all applicable Medicare documentation. We estimate the revenue on each shipment to a Medicare patient as a percentage of the total invoice based on the payment history of each regional administrative
	contractor. While we have contracted rates with Medicare, to the extent any claims for reimbursement are denied, we will recognize any necessary adjustments in the period for which the adjustment is
	made.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Accounts Receivable
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	The majority of our accounts receivable and revenues are from commercial insurance payers and government payers, such as Medicare, Veterans Administration and
	Medicaid.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	Accounts
	receivable are carried net of allowances for estimated non-receipt of patient co-payment and deductible obligations and allowances for uncollectible accounts. We believe all accounts
	receivable in excess of the allowance are fully collectible. We do not accrue interest on a majority of the past due accounts receivable. We determine when accounts become past due on a customer by
	customer basis. If accounts receivables in excess of the provided allowance are determined uncollectible, they are charged to expense in the quarter that determination is made and accounts receivable
	are written off after all collection efforts have failed. A portion of our claims to Medicare are initially denied, and enter the appeals process, where many are ultimately reviewed by an
	Administrative Law Judge. After final adjudication of all claims, approximately 90% of the claims submitted are approved (this is on a number of claims, not a dollars claimed, basis). Historically, we
	successfully appealed 90% of our initial Medicare claims denials. The appeal process can be lengthy, lasting more than a year in most cases. Accordingly, we classify a portion of our Medicare accounts
	receivable as non-current based on our experience with Medicare.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	As
	an alternative to individual appeals, Medicare may seek to settle a number of outstanding appeals at one time through a settlement conference. On September&nbsp;3, 2015, we entered into a
	settlement agreement with the Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services, or CMS, for 247 claims, representing approximately $1.46&nbsp;million of original claims based on the Medicare allowable
	rates, in which we had submitted a request for an Administrative Law Judge hearing in 2013. The settlement entitled us to receive a payment of approximately $0.85&nbsp;million. We received this full
	amount during the fourth quarter of 2015. The settlement resulted in a reduction in the fourth quarter of 2015 of $0.82&nbsp;million in our accounts receivable for shipment of products to patients
	covered by Medicare. The settlement was part of a pilot program, facilitated by the Office of Medicare Hearings and Appeals, to address a backlog of overdue claims awaiting Administrative Law Judge
	adjudication. Because the settlement is part of a pilot program, we cannot predict whether we will be able to conclude future settlements with Medicare or achieve settlements on similar terms. Any
	future settlement of claims for amounts less than the corresponding amounts receivable would result in a write off.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Stock-Based Compensation
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	We account for stock-based compensation awards at the fair value on the date of grant expensed over the applicable vesting period. The fair value of options
	on the grant date is
	estimated using the Black-Scholes option-pricing model. We recognize the fair value of each award as an expense on a
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	78
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE COLOR="#5D6E7E">
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=3,SEQ=83,EFW="2230336",CP="TACTILE SYSTEMS TECHNOLOGY INC.",DN="1",CHK=163703,FOLIO='78',FILE='DISK108:[16ZCR1.16ZCR46701]DA46701A.;13',USER='PANDERS',CD='21-NOV-2016;19:05' -->
<A NAME="A2230336ZS-1_HTM_PAGE_DA46701_1_79">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2230336ZS-1_HTM_BG46701A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	straight-line
	basis over the requisite service period, which is generally the vesting period of the equity grant.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	The
	Black-Scholes option-pricing model requires the input of highly subjective assumptions, including the expected term of the option, the expected volatility of the price of our common stock, the
	risk-free interest rate and the expected dividend yield. These estimates involve inherent uncertainties and the significant application of management's judgment. If factors change and different
	assumptions are used, our stock-based compensation expense could be materially different in the future. We determined weighted-average valuation assumptions as
	follows:
</FONT>
</P>
<UL>
<UL>
<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
<I>
	Expected term
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;We use the "simplified method" to determine the expected term of
	the stock option.
</FONT>
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
<I>
	Expected volatility
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Our expected volatility is derived using the historical
	volatility of a public company of similar size and industry because we believe the expected volatility will approximate historical volatility, due to the fact that we have no trading history.
</FONT>
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
<I>
	Risk-free interest rate
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The risk free interest rate is based on the yields of
	U.S. Treasury securities with maturities similar to the expected term of the options for each option group.
</FONT>
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
<I>
	Expected dividend yield
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;We have never declared or paid any cash dividends on
	our
	common stock and do not presently plan to pay cash dividends on our common stock in the foreseeable future. Consequently, we use an expected dividend yield of zero.
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>
</UL>
</UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	The
	following table summarizes the assumptions relating to our stock options for the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2014 and 2015 and the nine months ended September&nbsp;30, 2015 and 2016:
</FONT>
</P>

<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
</FONT>
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
