<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2230336ZS-1_HTM_BG46701A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
	Familial Relationships.
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;There is no family relationship between any director, executive officer or person nominated to become a director or
	executive officer.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
	Board Structure.
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Our board of directors currently is authorized to have eight members. In accordance with the terms of our amended and restated
	certificate of
	incorporation and amended and restated bylaws, our board of directors is not classified and each director serves for a one-year term until the next annual meetings of stockholders.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	In
	accordance with the terms of our amended and restated certificate of incorporation, our directors may be removed only for cause by the affirmative vote of the holders of at least 75% of the votes
	that all our stockholders would be entitled to cast in an election of directors.
</FONT>
</P>
<EFX_COMMITTEE_INTERLOCKS>
<A NAME="FIS_COMMITTEE_INTERLOCKS"></A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Compensation Committee Interlocks and Insider Participation
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	No member of our compensation and organization committee is or has been our current or former officer or employee. None of our executive officers served as a
	director or a member of a compensation committee (or other committee serving an equivalent function) of any other entity, one of whose executive officers served as a director or member of our
	compensation and organization committee during 2015.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Board Committees
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	Our board has established four standing committees&nbsp;&#151; audit, nominating and corporate governance, compensation and organization and
	compliance and reimbursement committee&nbsp;&#151; each of which operates under a charter that has been approved by our board. Each committee's charter is available under the Corporate
	Governance section of our website at
</FONT>
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
<I>
	www.tactilemedical.com
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	. The reference to our website address does not constitute incorporation by reference of the
	information contained at or available through our website, and you should not consider it to be a part of this prospectus.
</FONT>
</P>

<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
	Audit Committee.
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The audit committee's responsibilities include:
</FONT>
</P>
<UL>
<UL>
<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	appointing, compensating, retaining, replacing and overseeing our independent auditor;
</FONT>
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	pre-approving all audit and permitted non-audit services to be provided by our independent auditor;
</FONT>
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	assisting our board of directors in its oversight of our financial statements and other financial information to be provided by us;
</FONT>
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	overseeing our compliance with legal and regulatory matters and aspects of our risk management processes;
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>
</UL>
</UL>

<A NAME="A2230336ZS-1_HTM_PAGE_DM46701_1_124">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2230336ZS-1_HTM_BG46701A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<UL>
<UL>
<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	discussing with management and our independent auditors any major issues as to the adequacy of our internal controls, any actions to be taken
	in light of significant or material control deficiencies and the adequacy of disclosures about changes in internal control over financial reporting; and
</FONT>
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	establishing procedures for the receipt, retention and treatment of complaints regarding accounting, internal accounting controls or auditing
	matters and the confidential, anonymous submission by employees of concerns regarding questionable accounting or auditing matters.
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>
</UL>
</UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	Each
	of the members of our audit committee meets the requirements for financial literacy and possesses the financial qualifications required under the applicable rules and regulations of the SEC and
	the NASDAQ stock market. Our board of directors has determined that Richard Nigon is an audit committee financial expert, as defined under the applicable rules of the SEC. Each member of our audit
	committee satisfies the NASDAQ stock market independence standards and the independence standards of Rule&nbsp;10A-3(b)(1) of the Exchange Act.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
	Nominating and Corporate Governance Committee.
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The nominating and corporate governance committee's responsibilities include assisting our board
	in:
</FONT>
</P>
<UL>
<UL>
<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	identifying qualified individuals to become board members;
</FONT>
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	determining the composition of the board and its committees;
</FONT>
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	assessing and enhancing the effectiveness of the board and individual directors; and
</FONT>
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	developing and implementing our corporate governance guidelines.
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>
</UL>
</UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
	Compensation and Organization Committee.
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The compensation and organization committee's responsibilities include:
</FONT>
</P>
<UL>
<UL>
<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	determining the compensation of our chief executive officer and other executive officers;
</FONT>
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	providing oversight of our compensation policies, plans and benefit programs;
</FONT>
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	administering our equity compensation plans;
</FONT>
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	recommending to our board the compensation arrangements for our non-employee directors; and
</FONT>
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	overseeing and reviewing our executive team and management succession.
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>
</UL>
</UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
	Compliance and Reimbursement Committee.
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The compliance and reimbursement committee's responsibilities include:
</FONT>
</P>
<UL>
<UL>
<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	assisting the Board in overseeing our regulatory compliance activities; and
</FONT>
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	monitoring and evaluating our compliance with regulatory requirements to which we are subject.
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>
</UL>
</UL>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	124
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE COLOR="#5D6E7E">
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>

<!-- ZEQ.=6,SEQ=129,EFW="2230336",CP="TACTILE SYSTEMS TECHNOLOGY INC.",DN="1",CHK=584627,FOLIO='124',FILE='DISK108:[16ZCR1.16ZCR46701]DM46701A.;11',USER='GPEARMO',CD='21-NOV-2016;22:45' -->
<A NAME="A2230336ZS-1_HTM_PAGE_DM46701_1_125">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2230336ZS-1_HTM_BG46701A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Code of Business Conduct and Ethics
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	On June&nbsp;21, 2016, we adopted a code of business conduct and ethics relating to the conduct of our business by our employees, officers and directors,
	which is posted on our website. We intend to disclose any amendments to the code, or any waivers of its requirements, as required by stock exchange or SEC rules, on our website.
</FONT>
</P>
</EFX_COMMITTEE_INTERLOCKS>
</EFX_MANAGEMENT>
<EFX_DIRECTOR_COMPENSATION>
<A NAME="FIS_DIRECTOR_COMPENSATION"></A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Non-Employee Director Compensation
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	Our non-employee directors receive cash compensation as follows:
</FONT>
</P>
<UL>
<UL>
<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	each non-employee director receives an annual cash retainer of $35,000 per year;
</FONT>
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	the chairman of our board of directors receives an additional cash retainer of $35,000 per year;
</FONT>
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	the chairman of the audit committee receives an additional cash retainer of $16,000 per year;
</FONT>
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	each member of the audit committee (other than the chairman) receives an additional cash retainer of $8,000 per year;
</FONT>
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	the chairman of the compensation and organization committee receives an additional cash retainer of $12,000 per year;
</FONT>
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	each member of the compensation and organization committee (other than the chairman) receives an additional cash retainer of $6,000 per year;
</FONT>
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	the chairman of the nominating and corporate governance committee receives an additional cash retainer of $8,000 per year;
</FONT>
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	each member of the nominating and corporate governance committee (other than the chairman) receives an additional cash retainer of $4,000 per
	year;
</FONT>
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	the chairman of the compliance and reimbursement committee receives an additional cash retainer of $8,000 per year; and
</FONT>
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	each member of the compliance and reimbursement committee (other than the chairman) receives an additional cash retainer of $4,000 per year.
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>
</UL>
</UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	Non-employee
	directors may elect to receive between 10% and 100% of their aggregate annual cash retainers in the form of RSUs, with the number of RSUs calculated by dividing the amount of the retainer
	payable on a certain date by the closing sale price per share of our common stock on the date of grant.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	We
	also reimburse our directors for their reasonable out-of-pocket expenses incurred in connection with attending our board and committee meetings.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	In
	addition, we expect to grant each of our non-employee directors as annual equity award grants:
</FONT>
</P>
<UL>
<UL>
<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	a non-statutory stock option to purchase up to $50,000 of shares of our common stock calculated as the grant date fair value of the stock-based
	awards computed in accordance
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>
</UL>
</UL>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	125
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE COLOR="#5D6E7E">
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=7,SEQ=130,EFW="2230336",CP="TACTILE SYSTEMS TECHNOLOGY INC.",DN="1",CHK=88986,FOLIO='125',FILE='DISK108:[16ZCR1.16ZCR46701]DM46701A.;11',USER='GPEARMO',CD='21-NOV-2016;22:45' -->
<A NAME="A2230336ZS-1_HTM_PAGE_DM46701_1_126">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2230336ZS-1_HTM_BG46701A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<UL>
<UL>
<UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	with
	FASB Topic ASC 718 on the date of grant using the closing sale price per share of our common stock on the date of grant, which will be the date of the annual meeting of stockholders in each year;
	and
</FONT>
</P>
</UL>
<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	RSUs that have a value of $50,000, with the number of RSUs calculated by dividing $50,000 by the closing sale price per share of our common
	stock on the date of grant, which will be the date of the annual meeting of stockholders in each year.
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>
</UL>
</UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	Each
	option will have an exercise price per share equal to the fair market value on the date of grant, which will be the closing sale price per share of our common stock on the date of the annual
	meeting of stockholders in each year. Each stock option and RSU award will vest in full on the earlier of (a)&nbsp;one year from the date of grant or (b)&nbsp;immediately prior to the next annual
	meeting of stockholders following the date of such grant, subject to such director's continued service on our board of directors as of such date. Each stock option will have a term of seven years from
	the date of grant.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	In
	connection with the IPO, we granted each non-employee director 5,000&nbsp;RSUs and a stock option to purchase 14,370 shares of our common stock at an exercise price of $10.00 per share. These
	RSUs and stock options vest in full on the earlier of July&nbsp;27, 2017 or immediately prior to the next annual meeting of stockholders. Further, in connection with the IPO, we granted
	Mr.&nbsp;Burke 2,500 RSUs, which vest in full on the six month anniversary of the date of grant. These RSUs were granted to Mr.&nbsp;Burke because he joined our board of directors in September
	2015 and had not received an equity-based grant similar to grants that other directors had previously received.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	126
</FONT>
</P>

<HR NOSHADE COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE="1.0PT" WIDTH="39%" ALIGN="LEFT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="PADDING:0PT;POSITION:RELATIVE;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;MARGIN-LEFT:10%;">
<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-9PT;'>

	(1)
</SUP>
</FONT>
</DT>
</EFX_COMPENSATION_TABLE>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=1>
	Represents
	amounts paid to the named executive officer for a car allowance.
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Employment Agreements
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	We have entered into employment agreements with each of our executive officers. The employment agreements continue in effect until the executive officer's
	employment is terminated by us, the executive or upon his or her disability or death. The employment agreements provide for certain payments upon various employment termination scenarios. The terms
	and amounts of potential payments upon the termination of the executive officers' employment are summarized below under "&#151; Potential Payments Upon Termination or Change-in-Control."
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	The
	employment agreements provide for the following for the executive officers: (i)&nbsp;a specified annual base salary, which after the first year, may be reviewed and increased in the compensation
	committee's sole discretion; (ii)&nbsp;for each calendar year that the executive officer is employed by us, he or she will be eligible for an annual target bonus in an amount that is a specified
	percentage of his or her base salary, based upon and subject to criteria set by the compensation committee from time to time; (iii)&nbsp;being eligible to receive equity awards as determined in the
	compensation committee's discretion; (iv)&nbsp;being entitled to participate in all of our employee benefit plans and programs, to the extent eligible; (v)&nbsp;business expense reimbursement;
	(vi)&nbsp;specified paid time off per year. The employment agreements currently contain the following specified annual base salary amount for the first year: Mr.&nbsp;Mattys: $390,000;
	Ms.&nbsp;Blake: $300,000; Mr.&nbsp;Folkes: $260,000; and Mr.&nbsp;Rishe: $257,500. The employment agreements contain, the following percentages of base salary for which the officer is eligible
	under the annual target bonus: Mr.&nbsp;Mattys: 75%; Ms.&nbsp;Blake: 50%; Mr.&nbsp;Folkes: 45% and Mr.&nbsp;Rishe: 45%.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	Pursuant
	to the employment agreements, each executive officer agrees to not at any time disclose our confidential, proprietary or secret information. The employment agreements contain non-competition
	provisions that are in effect during the executive's employment with us, and (i)&nbsp;(A) in the case of Mr.&nbsp;Mattys, if his employment is terminated by us without cause, by Mr.&nbsp;Mattys
	for good reason, due to Mr.&nbsp;Mattys' disability or as the result of a qualifying termination after a change in control, for an additional 15&nbsp;months following the termination of
	Mr.&nbsp;Mattys' employment, (B)&nbsp;in the case of
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	127
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE COLOR="#5D6E7E">
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=1,SEQ=132,EFW="2230336",CP="TACTILE SYSTEMS TECHNOLOGY INC.",DN="1",CHK=412698,FOLIO='127',FILE='DISK108:[16ZCR1.16ZCR46701]DO46701A.;18',USER='GPEARMO',CD='21-NOV-2016;22:45' -->
<A NAME="A2230336ZS-1_HTM_PAGE_DO46701_1_128">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2230336ZS-1_HTM_BG46701A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	Mr.&nbsp;Rishe,
	if his employment is terminated by us without cause, by Mr.&nbsp;Rishe for good reason, due to Mr.&nbsp;Rishe's disability or as the result of a qualifying termination after a
	change in control, for an additional nine months following the termination of Mr.&nbsp;Rishe's employment, (C)&nbsp;in the case of the other executive officers, if the executive's employment is
	terminated by us without cause or by the executive for good reason, for an additional nine months following the executive's termination of employment, provided that in each case we may elect to extend
	that period by an additional six months by making additional payments to the executive, and (ii)&nbsp;(A)&nbsp;in the case of Mr.&nbsp;Mattys and Mr.&nbsp;Rishe, if the executive's employment
	is terminated for any reason other than by us without cause, by the executive for good reason, due to the executive's disability or as the result of a qualifying termination after a change in control,
	an additional 12&nbsp;months following the executive's termination of employment, and (B)&nbsp;in the case of the other executive officers, if the executive's employment is terminated for any
	reason other than by us without cause or by the executive for good reason, an additional 12&nbsp;months following the executive's termination of employment. The employment agreements also provide
	that, during the executive officer's employment with us and for a period of 12&nbsp;months after termination of his or her employment for any reason, the executive officer will not solicit or hire
	our employees and contractors and will not solicit or induce any customer, supplier or other business contact of ours to cancel, curtail or otherwise adversely change its relationship with us.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Equity Awards
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	We did not grant any stock option or other equity-based awards to any of our named executive officers during 2015.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Non-Equity Incentive Plan Compensation
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	The non-equity incentive plan compensation earned by each of our named executive officers other than Mr.&nbsp;Rishe during 2015 reflected their
	participation in our 2015 Bonus Plan. As Vice President, Sales, Mr.&nbsp;Rishe's 2015 bonus opportunity was subject to a separate bonus arrangement described below.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	Our
	2015 Bonus Plan incorporated both company financial objectives and company and departmental operational objectives. The company's performance against objectives based on 2015 revenue and 2015
	operating income excluding specific board approved expenditures would determine the degree to which a bonus pool would be funded, with payouts from the bonus pool dependent upon the degree to which
	financial and operational objectives were achieved. The bonus pool would not be funded if operating income excluding specific board approved expenditures for 2015 was less than $4.5&nbsp;million.
	Threshold, target and maximum funding levels of $1.2&nbsp;million, $2.0&nbsp;million and $2.5&nbsp;million respectively, were prescribed depending on the degree to which the financial objectives
	were achieved. The bonus pool would be funded at the target level if 2015 revenues were $63.0&nbsp;million and 2015 operating income excluding specific board approved expenditures was
	$6.5&nbsp;million, with those metrics assigned relative weightings of 80% and 20%, respectively. Operational objectives generally involved measures to increase efficiencies and reimbursements and
	advance clinical studies and submissions.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	Individual
	payouts from the bonus pool for more senior bonus plan participants, including the named executive officers, were based 80% on achievement of financial objectives and 20% on achievement of
	operational objectives.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	128
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE COLOR="#5D6E7E">
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>

	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="CENTER" VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	37.8%
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<!-- END OF USER-SPECIFIED TAGGED TABLE -->
</DIV>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	Mr.&nbsp;Rishe's
	2015 bonus opportunity was a function of the degree to which our company achieved monthly and quarterly sales objectives and quarterly sales department expense management goals.
	These bonus amounts were payable to Mr.&nbsp;Rishe following the close of the applicable month or quarter during 2015. Mr.&nbsp;Rishe's maximum bonus opportunity for 2015 was approximately 69% of
	his base salary, and his actual payout was approximately 54% of his base salary.
</FONT>
</P>
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_22"></A>

<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-9PT;'>
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=1>
<SUP>
	(1)
</SUP>
</FONT>
</DT>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=1>
	Option
	awards provide a recipient the right to acquire shares of our common stock. All options vested as to 25% of the shares on the first anniversary of the grant
	date, with the remaining 75% of the shares vesting in 36&nbsp;monthly installments.
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-9PT;'>
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=1>
<SUP>
	(2)
</SUP>
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=1>
	Stock
	awards consist of restricted shares of our Series&nbsp;A preferred stock, which converted into restricted shares of our common stock in connection with the
	IPO.
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-9PT;'>
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=1>
<SUP>
	(3)
</SUP>
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=1>
	The
	market value of restricted shares of our Series&nbsp;A preferred stock that had not vested as of December&nbsp;31, 2015 was based on a fair market value of
	$15.00 per share as of December&nbsp;31, 2015, as determined by our board of directors.
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-9PT;'>
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=1>
<SUP>
	(4)
</SUP>
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">

	The
	unvested shares of common stock subject to this option vest in 22 equal installments on the 9
<SUP>
	th
</SUP>
	&nbsp;day of each month from January 2016 through
	October 2017.
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-9PT;'>

	(5)
</SUP>

</DT>

<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=1>
	The
	unvested restricted shares of our Series&nbsp;A preferred stock (which were converted into restricted shares of our common stock in connection with the IPO)
	vest upon the earlier of a change in control of our company or May&nbsp;2, 2017, the nine month anniversary of the closing of the IPO.
</FONT>
</DD>

<!-- ZEQ.=3,SEQ=134,EFW="2230336",CP="TACTILE SYSTEMS TECHNOLOGY INC.",DN="1",CHK=677182,FOLIO='129',FILE='DISK108:[16ZCR1.16ZCR46701]DO46701A.;18',USER='GPEARMO',CD='21-NOV-2016;22:45' -->
<A NAME="A2230336ZS-1_HTM_PAGE_DO46701_1_130">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2230336ZS-1_HTM_BG46701A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	IPO Equity Grants
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	In connection with the IPO, we granted the following number of RSUs to our named executive officers: Mr.&nbsp;Mattys: 60,000 RSUs; Mr.&nbsp;Folkes: 34,800
	RSUs; and Mr.&nbsp;Rishe: 27,000 RSUs. These RSUs will vest as to 50% of the shares on January&nbsp;1, 2018 and as to 50% of the shares on January&nbsp;1, 2019, subject to continued employment
	on each vesting date.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Pension Benefits for 2015
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	We do not offer pension benefits to our named executive officers.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Non-Qualified Deferred Compensation for 2015
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	We do not offer non-qualified deferred compensation to our named executive officers.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Potential Payments Upon Termination or Change-in-Control
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	Our 2003 Stock Option Plan, which we refer to as the 2003 Plan, our 2007 Omnibus Stock Plan, which we refer to as the 2007 Plan, our restricted stock award
	agreements, pursuant to which restricted shares of our Series&nbsp;A preferred stock were granted to certain employees, which we refer to as the Series&nbsp;A Restricted Stock, and our 2016 Equity
	Incentive Plan, which we refer to as the 2016 Plan, address the effect of a grantee's termination of service or a change in control of our company on outstanding awards granted under those plans and
	agreements. See "&#151; Stock Option and Other Equity Compensation Plans" below.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
	Employment Agreements.
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;We have entered into an employment agreement with our executive officers. The employment agreements provide for the
	following:
</FONT>
</P>
<UL>
<UL>
<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	if we terminate the executive officer's employment without cause, or if the executive terminates his or her employment for good reason, or in
	the case of Mr.&nbsp;Mattys and Mr.&nbsp;Rishe, if we terminate their employment for death, disability or as the result of a qualifying termination after a change in control as defined under the
	2016 Plan, we will pay, in addition to amounts that have been earned prior to the termination date, the following severance benefits:
</FONT>
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	as to Mr.&nbsp;Mattys, an amount equal to 125% of his then-current annualized base salary, and as to the other executive
	officers, an amount equal to 75% of the executive officer's then-current annualized base salary;
</FONT>
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	as to Mr.&nbsp;Mattys, an amount equal to 125% of his then-current annual target bonus, and as to the other executive officers,
	an amount equal to 75% of the executive officer's then-current annual target bonus;
</FONT>
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	payment of the portion of the premium costs for group health insurance coverage that we would pay if he or she remained employed
	by us at the same level of coverage, for a period of 15&nbsp;months in the case of Mr.&nbsp;Mattys and nine months in the case of the other executive officers, after his or her employment
	termination date or until he or she receives group health or dental coverage from another employer, if earlier;
</FONT>
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	payment of the value of the executive officer's accrued and unused paid time off,
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>
</UL>
</UL>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	130
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE COLOR="#5D6E7E">
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=4,SEQ=135,EFW="2230336",CP="TACTILE SYSTEMS TECHNOLOGY INC.",DN="1",CHK=348806,FOLIO='130',FILE='DISK108:[16ZCR1.16ZCR46701]DO46701A.;18',USER='GPEARMO',CD='21-NOV-2016;22:45' -->
<A NAME="A2230336ZS-1_HTM_PAGE_DO46701_1_131">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2230336ZS-1_HTM_BG46701A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<UL>
<UL>
<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<BR>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	payable,
	in the case of the first three bullets above, in equal installments in accordance with our customary payroll practices over the course of nine
	months (15&nbsp;months for Mr.&nbsp;Mattys), subject to potential 409A limitations;
</FONT>
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	if we terminate the executive officer's employment without cause or the executive terminates his or her employment for good reason, then any of
	the executive's unvested equity awards will vest in an amount equal to the pro rata portion of the total number of securities issuable pursuant to the awards based on the number of days served in the
	vesting period less any amount already vested; and
</FONT>
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	if we terminate the executive officer's employment for cause, if he or she terminates his or her employment for any reason other than good
	reason, or in the event of his or her death or disability (except for Mr.&nbsp;Mattys and Mr.&nbsp;Rishe who also have severance rights if employment is terminated as the result of a qualifying
	termination after a change in control), no amounts other than what he or she has earned prior to the termination date is payable.
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>
</UL>
</UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	If
	we elect to extend the time during which the non-competition provisions continue following our termination of the executive officer's employment without cause, or following his or her termination
	of employment for good reason, or in the case of Mr.&nbsp;Mattys and Mr.&nbsp;Rishe, if we terminate their employment for disability or as the result of a qualifying termination after a change in
	control, we will pay to him or her an additional amount equal to the monthly amount payable under those termination circumstances as described above for an additional six months and extend for an
	additional six months (three months for Mr.&nbsp;Mattys) the period during which we will pay a portion of the premium costs for group health insurance coverage as described above.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	"Cause"
	is defined under the employment agreements as: (i)&nbsp;an act or acts of dishonesty undertaken by the executive officer and intended to result in personal gain or enrichment of the
	executive or others at our expense; (ii)&nbsp;unlawful conduct or gross misconduct by the executive officer that, in either event, is injurious to us; (iii)&nbsp;the conviction of the executive
	officer of a felony; or (iv)&nbsp;material breach of any terms or conditions of the employment agreement by the executive officer which breach has not been cured by the executive officer within
	15&nbsp;days after written notice thereof from us.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	The
	employment agreements provide that "good reason" means the occurrence of any of the following events without the executive officer's consent: (i)&nbsp;the assignment of the executive officer to
	a position with responsibilities or duties of a materially lesser status or degree than the position specified in his or her employment agreement; (ii)&nbsp;a material breach of any terms or
	conditions of the employment
	agreement by us not caused by the executive officer; or (iii)&nbsp;the requirement by us that the executive officer relocate out of the current metropolitan area where that executive officer
	resides.
</FONT>
</P>
<EFX_STOCK_PLANS>
<A NAME="FIS_STOCK_PLANS"></A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Stock Option and Other Equity Compensation Plans
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	In this section we describe our 2003 Plan, our 2007 Plan, our Series&nbsp;A Restricted Stock agreements, our 2016 Plan and our Employee Stock Purchase Plan,
	which we refer to as the ESPP.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
	2003 Stock Option Plan.
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Our 2003 Plan was originally approved by our board of directors and our stockholders in 2003, amended in 2005 and
	amended and restated in
	August 2006. As of November&nbsp;10, 2016, there were 28,723 shares of our common stock subject to outstanding stock options under the 2003 Plan. Since the 2007 Plan became effective, no additional
	awards have been granted under the 2003 Plan and no additional awards will be granted under the 2003 Plan in the future.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	131
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE COLOR="#5D6E7E">
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=5,SEQ=136,EFW="2230336",CP="TACTILE SYSTEMS TECHNOLOGY INC.",DN="1",CHK=767971,FOLIO='131',FILE='DISK108:[16ZCR1.16ZCR46701]DO46701A.;18',USER='GPEARMO',CD='21-NOV-2016;22:45' -->
<A NAME="A2230336ZS-1_HTM_PAGE_DO46701_1_132">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2230336ZS-1_HTM_BG46701A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	All
	shares subject to awards outstanding under the 2003 Plan as of July&nbsp;27, 2016, the effective date of the 2016 Plan, that thereafter are forfeited, expire, are cancelled or otherwise do not
	result in the issuance of shares will become available for grant under the 2016 Plan in accordance with its terms. All awards outstanding under the 2003 Plan remain outstanding in accordance with
	their terms and will continue to be governed by their existing terms.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
<I>
	Eligibility.
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The 2003 Plan provides for the grant of stock options to any person who provides services to us, whether as an employee, director,
	consultant or
	advisor. Incentive and nonqualified stock options could be granted to employees, but only nonqualified stock options could be granted to other eligible participants.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
<I>
	Administration.
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Our compensation and organization committee administers the 2003 Plan and the awards granted under it, except for awards to our
	non-employee
	directors which are administered by our board of directors. The plan administrator (compensation and organization committee or the board, as applicable) has the authority to, among other things, make
	decisions and determinations related to the 2003 Plan and awards thereunder, including determining who shall receive awards, the types of awards granted and the terms and conditions of the awards and
	to adopt rules for the administration of the 2003 Plan. To the extent permitted by law, the plan administrator may delegate all or part of its authority under the 2003 Plan to our chief executive
	officer.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
<I>
	Stock Options.
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Stock options granted under the 2003 Plan are evidenced by stock option award agreements, containing such provisions as the plan
	administrator deems
	advisable. All options still outstanding under the 2003 Plan expire not more than ten years after the date of the grant, have a per share exercise price that is equal to the fair market value of a
	share of our common stock as of the date the option was granted, and are fully vested and exercisable.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	Upon
	the termination of an optionee's employment or other service relationship with us: (i)&nbsp;if the termination is due to death or disability, options shall immediately vest and become
	exercisable in full and shall remain exercisable for one year after such termination; (ii)&nbsp;if the termination is for "cause," outstanding options shall immediately expire upon such termination;
	and (iii)&nbsp;if the termination is for any reason other than death, disability or cause, then to the extent any outstanding options are not then vested and exercisable, they shall immediately
	terminate, but to the extent they are already vested and exercisable, they shall remain exercisable for nine months following such termination. In no event, however, will an option remain exercisable
	past its originally scheduled expiration date.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
<I>
	Change in Control.
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In the event of a change in control of our company, the plan administrator may, in its discretion, cause any outstanding option to
	immediately
	become vested and exercisable in full. The plan administrator may also cause outstanding options to be assumed or replaced by an acquirer in a merger, consolidation or sale of substantially all of the
	company's assets, or provide for outstanding options to be cancelled upon a change in control in exchange for a cash payment reflecting the intrinsic value of the options.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	For
	purposes of the 2003 Plan, a "change in control" generally refers to a person acquiring beneficial ownership of 30% or more of the combined voting power of the company's voting securities; the
	approval by the company's stockholders of a merger, consolidation or statutory share exchange involving the company, of the sale of all or substantially all of the company's assets or of the
	liquidation or dissolution of the company; or a majority of the members of the company's board ceasing to be "continuing" directors. Under the 2003 Plan, "cause" is generally defined to include a
	material breach of any agreement between the company and the optionee, gross negligence or willful misconduct by the optionee, the optionee's conviction of a felony or crime involving moral turpitude,
	the optionee's willful violation of specific and lawful work-related instructions or prolonged or
	frequent unexcused absences from work, or fraud, theft or proven dishonesty by the optionee against the company.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	132
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE COLOR="#5D6E7E">
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>

<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A NAME="A2230336ZS-1_HTM_PAGE_DQ46701_1_133">
</A>
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_BASECOLOR,"#5D6E7E" -->
</FONT>
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_DEFAULTFONT,"FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;" -->

</FONT>
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2230336ZS-1_HTM_BG46701A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
<I>
	Registration.
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;We filed with the SEC a registration statement on Form&nbsp;S-8 covering the shares of our common stock issuable under the 2003 Plan.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
	2007 Omnibus Stock Plan.
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Our 2007 Plan was approved by our board of directors and our stockholders in 2007, was amended and restated in 2008 and
	was further
	amended in 2012 and 2014. As of November&nbsp;10, 2016, there were 1,552,070 shares subject to outstanding awards under the 2007 Plan. Since the 2016 Plan became effective on July&nbsp;27, 2016,
	no additional awards have been granted under the 2007 Plan and no additional awards will be granted under the 2007 Plan in the future.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	All
	shares remaining available for the grant of awards under the 2007 Plan as of the effective date of the 2016 Plan have been carried over into the 2016 Plan, and all shares subject to awards
	outstanding under the 2007 Plan on the effective date of the 2016 Plan that thereafter are forfeited, expire, are cancelled or otherwise do not result in the issuance of shares will become available
	for grant under the
	2016 Plan in accordance with its terms. All awards outstanding under the 2007 Plan remain outstanding in accordance with their terms and continue to be governed by their existing terms.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
<I>
	Eligibility.
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The 2007 Plan provides for the grant of equity-based awards to any person that provides services to us, whether as an employee, director,
	consultant
	or advisor.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
<I>
	Administration.
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Our compensation and organization committee administers the 2007 Plan and the awards granted under it, except for awards to our
	non-employee
	directors which are administered by our board. The plan administrator (compensation and organization committee or the board, as applicable) has the authority to, among other things, make decisions and
	determinations related to the 2007 Plan and awards thereunder, including determining who shall receive awards, the types of awards granted and the terms and conditions of the awards, adopt rules for
	the administration of the 2007 Plan, interpret the 2007 Plan and amend the terms of awards thereunder. To the extent permitted by law, the plan administrator may delegate all or part of its authority
	under the 2007 Plan with respect to awards to persons who are not officers or directors of the company to one or more persons who are not non-employee directors.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
<I>
	Types of Awards.
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Awards under the 2007 Plan may be in the form of stock options, stock appreciation rights, or SARs, restricted stock, performance
	units or other
	stock-based awards. Each award is to be evidenced by an award agreement containing the terms and conditions of the award. Only stock options have been granted under the 2007 Plan.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	Any
	stock option granted under the 2007 Plan shall have a term as specified by the plan administrator, not to exceed ten years after the date of the grant in the case of an incentive stock option, and
	have a per share exercise price, which is determined by the plan administrator and which may not be less than the fair market value of a share of our common stock as of the date the option is granted.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	Upon
	the termination of an optionee's employment with us: (i)&nbsp;options that are not then vested and exercisable shall immediately terminate; (ii)&nbsp;if the termination is due to death or
	disability, options shall remain exercisable for one year after such termination to the extent they were exercisable immediately before such termination; (iii)&nbsp;if the termination is for
	"cause," outstanding options shall immediately terminate upon such termination; and (iv)&nbsp;if the termination is for any reason other than death, disability or cause, then they shall remain
	exercisable for nine months following such termination to the extent they were exercisable immediately before such termination. In no event, however, will an option remain exercisable past its
	originally scheduled expiration date. If a non-employee director's service relationship with the company terminates, any stock option will remain exercisable for the remainder of its scheduled term to
	the extent it was exercisable immediately before such termination.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	133
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE COLOR="#5D6E7E">
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>

<A NAME="A2230336ZS-1_HTM_PAGE_DQ46701_1_134">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2230336ZS-1_HTM_BG46701A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
<I>
	Change in Control.
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In the event of a change in control of our company, the plan administrator may, in its discretion, cause any outstanding option to
	immediately
	become vested and exercisable in full and to remain exercisable during its scheduled term. The plan administrator may also cause outstanding options to be assumed or replaced by an acquirer in a
	merger, consolidation or sale of substantially all of the company's assets, or provide for outstanding options to be cancelled upon a change in control in exchange for a cash payment reflecting the
	intrinsic value of the options. Unless otherwise provided in an agreement with our company, if the accelerated vesting of an award or payment of cash in exchange for an award that would otherwise
	occur in connection with a change in control would, together with any other payments to the same individual that are deemed contingent on a change in control, be characterized as a "parachute payment"
	under Code Section&nbsp;280G, then accelerated vesting or payment of cash in exchange for an award shall be reduced to the extent necessary to avoid the imposition of the excise tax on "excess
	parachute payments" required by Code Section&nbsp;4999.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	For
	purposes of the 2007 Plan, "change in control" is defined in the same manner as in the 2003 Plan, except that a person must acquire beneficial ownership of 50% or more of the company's voting
	securities, rather than 30% or more, and a merger, consolidation or statutory share exchange involving the company, a sale of all or substantially all of the company's assets or the liquidation or
	dissolution of the company will constitute a change in control only upon consummation of the transaction, rather than upon stockholder approval of the transaction.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
<I>
	Registration.
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;We intend to file with the SEC a registration statement on Form&nbsp;S-8 covering the shares of our common stock issuable under the 2007
	Plan.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
	Series&nbsp;A Restricted Stock.
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In March 2009, we issued awards to certain of our employees of restricted shares of our Series&nbsp;A preferred
	stock. The
	shares of Series&nbsp;A Restricted Stock converted into restricted shares of our common stock in connection with our IPO.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
	2016 Equity Incentive Plan.
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Our board of directors adopted the 2016 Plan in 2016 and our stockholders approved the 2016 Plan in 2016. The
	purposes of the 2016 Plan
	are to attract and retain
	the best available personnel, to provide them with additional incentives and to align their interests with those of our stockholders. The material terms of the 2016 Plan are summarized below.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
<I>
	Share Reserve.
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;As of November 10, 2016, there were 305,236 stock options and 326,388 RSUs outstanding under the 2016 Plan. The 2016 Plan provides that
	4,800,000
	shares may be the subject of awards and issued under the plan. In connection with the IPO, we granted 274,220 stock options and 307,594 RSUs to our employees and directors with an exercise price for
	stock options equal to $10.00 per share. In connection with the IPO, we also granted (a)&nbsp;an aggregate of $350,000 for grants of non-statutory stock options to our directors and (b)&nbsp;an
	aggregate $350,000 for grants of RSUs to our directors, on the terms described above. The 2016 Plan's share reserve increases on January&nbsp;1 of each year beginning in 2017 and ending on
	January&nbsp;1, 2026 in an amount equal to the least of: (i)&nbsp;5% of the total number of shares outstanding as of December&nbsp;31 of the immediately preceding calendar year;
	(ii)&nbsp;2,500,000 shares; or (iii)&nbsp;a number of shares determined by our board of directors. Shares subject to awards under the 2016 Plan, the 2007 Plan or the 2003 Plan that expire
	unexercised, are cancelled or forfeited, are settled for cash or otherwise do not result in the issuance of all or a portion of the shares subject to the award will replenish the 2016 Plan's share
	reserve. If the payment of the exercise price of any award under the 2016 Plan, the 2007 Plan or the 2003 Plan is made by the tendering or withholding of shares or if any applicable tax withholding
	obligation arising from an award under any of those plans is satisfied by the tendering or withholding of shares, the shares tendered or withheld also will replenish the 2016 Plan's share reserve.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	134
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE COLOR="#5D6E7E">
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=2,SEQ=139,EFW="2230336",CP="TACTILE SYSTEMS TECHNOLOGY INC.",DN="1",CHK=854206,FOLIO='134',FILE='DISK108:[16ZCR1.16ZCR46701]DQ46701A.;14',USER='GPEARMO',CD='21-NOV-2016;22:45' -->
<A NAME="A2230336ZS-1_HTM_PAGE_DQ46701_1_135">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2230336ZS-1_HTM_BG46701A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	Awards
	granted or shares of our common stock issued under the 2016 Plan upon the assumption of, or in substitution or exchange for, outstanding equity awards previously granted by an entity acquired
	by us or any of our subsidiaries (referred to as "substitute awards") will not reduce the share reserve under the 2016 Plan. Additionally, if a company acquired by us or any of our subsidiaries has
	shares available under a pre-existing plan approved by its stockholders and not adopted in contemplation of such acquisition, the unused shares under that pre-existing plan may be used for awards
	under the 2016 Plan and will not reduce the share reserve under the 2016 Plan, but only if the awards are made to individuals who were not employed by or providing services to us or any of our
	subsidiaries immediately prior to such acquisition.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
<I>
	Administration of Plan.
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The compensation and organization committee of our board of directors administers the 2016 Plan, other than with respect to
	awards to our
	non-employee directors, which is administered by the full board of directors. We refer to the compensation and organization committee or the board of directors, as applicable, as the plan
	administrator in this section. Subject to the terms of the 2016 Plan, the plan administrator has the authority to, among other things, determine the persons to whom awards will be granted, the timing,
	type and number of shares covered by each
	award, and the terms and conditions of the awards. The plan administrator may also require or permit the deferral of the settlement of an award, establish and modify rules to administer the plan,
	interpret the plan and any related award agreement, cancel or suspend an award, accelerate the vesting of an award, and otherwise modify or amend the terms of outstanding awards to the extent
	permitted under the plan. Unless an amendment to the terms of an award is necessary to comply with applicable laws, stock exchange rules or compensation recovery policy, a participant whose rights
	would be materially impaired by such an amendment must consent to it.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	Except
	in connection with changes in the Company's capitalization in which share adjustments are specifically authorized, the 2016 Plan prohibits the plan administrator from repricing any outstanding
	"underwater" option or SAR awards without the prior approval of our stockholders. For these purposes, a "repricing" includes amending the terms of an option or SAR award to lower the exercise price,
	canceling an option or SAR award in exchange for replacement option or SAR awards having a lower exercise price, or canceling an underwater option or SAR award in exchange for cash, other property or
	a "full value award," which is an equity-based award other than an option or SAR award.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	To
	the extent permitted by law and stock exchange rules, the 2016 Plan permits the plan administrator to delegate its duties, power and authority under the plan to any of its members, to our executive
	officers or non-employee directors with respect to awards to participants who are not themselves our directors or executive officers, or to one or more agents or advisors with respect to
	non-discretionary administrative duties.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
<I>
	Eligibility
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Our employees, non-employee directors and certain consultants and advisors who provide services to us are eligible to receive awards under
	the 2016
	Plan. Incentive stock options may be granted only to our employees.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
<I>
	Equity Awards
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The 2016 Plan allows us to grant stock options, SARs, restricted stock, stock units and other stock-based awards. Each award will be
	evidenced by an
	agreement with the award recipient setting forth the terms and conditions of the award, including vesting conditions. Awards under the 2016 Plan will have a maximum term of ten years from the date of
	grant. The plan administrator may provide that the vesting or payment of any award will be subject to the attainment of certain performance measures established by the plan administrator, and the plan
	administrator will determine whether such measures have been achieved.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	135
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE COLOR="#5D6E7E">
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=3,SEQ=140,EFW="2230336",CP="TACTILE SYSTEMS TECHNOLOGY INC.",DN="1",CHK=960072,FOLIO='135',FILE='DISK108:[16ZCR1.16ZCR46701]DQ46701A.;14',USER='GPEARMO',CD='21-NOV-2016;22:45' -->
<A NAME="A2230336ZS-1_HTM_PAGE_DQ46701_1_136">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2230336ZS-1_HTM_BG46701A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<UL>
<UL>
<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
<I>
	Stock Options
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Stock options permit the holder to purchase a specified number of
	shares of our common stock at a set price. Options granted under the 2016 Plan may be either incentive or nonqualified stock options. The per share exercise price of options granted under the plan may
	not be less than the fair market value of a share of our common stock on the date of grant, except in the case of substitute awards. Incentive stock options granted to employees who hold more than 10%
	of the total combined voting power of our stock will have an exercise price not less than 110% of the fair market value of our common stock on the date of grant and will have a maximum term of five
	years. The maximum number of shares that may be issued upon the exercise of incentive stock options under the 2016 Plan is 4,800,000. The total purchase price of the shares to be purchased upon
	exercise of an option will be paid by the participant in cash unless the plan administrator allows exercise payments to be made (i)&nbsp;by means of a broker-assisted sale and remittance program,
	(ii)&nbsp;by delivery to us of shares of common stock already owned by the participant, or (iii)&nbsp;by a "net exercise" of the option in which a portion of the shares otherwise issuable upon
	exercise of the option are withheld by us.
</FONT>
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
<I>
	SARs
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;SARs provide for payment to the holder of all or a portion of the excess of
	the fair market value of a specified number of shares of our common stock on the date of exercise over the aggregate exercise price for that number of shares. Payment may be made in cash or shares of
	our common stock or a combination of both, as determined by the plan administrator. The exercise price per share of a SAR award will be determined by the plan administrator, but may not be less than
	100% of the fair market value of one share of our common stock on the date of grant, unless the SAR is granted as a substitute award.
</FONT>
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
<I>
	Restricted Stock.
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;A restricted stock award is an award of our common stock that
	vests at such times and in such installments as is determined by the plan administrator. Until it vests, the shares subject to the award are subject to restrictions on transferability and the
	possibility of forfeiture. The plan administrator may impose such restrictions or conditions to the vesting of restricted stock awards as it deems appropriate, including that the participant remain
	continuously in our service for a certain period or that we, or any of our subsidiaries or business units, satisfy specified performance goals. Participants are entitled to vote shares of restricted
	stock prior to the time they vest.
</FONT>
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
<I>
	Stock Units.
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The grant of a stock unit provides the right to receive the fair
	market value of a share of our common stock, payable in cash, shares, or a combination of both as determined by the plan administrator. A stock unit award vests at such times and in such installments
	as is determined by the plan administrator. Until it vests, a stock unit award is subject to restrictions on transferability and the possibility of forfeiture. The plan administrator may impose such
	restrictions or conditions to the vesting of stock unit awards as it deems appropriate.
</FONT>
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
<I>
	Other Stock-Based Awards.
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The plan administrator, in its discretion, may grant
	awards of common stock and other awards that are valued by reference to and/or payable in shares of our common stock under the 2016 Plan. The administrator will set the terms and conditions of such
	awards.
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>
</UL>
</UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
<I>
	Maximum Awards to Individual Participants.
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The number of shares of our common stock subject to options or SARs that may be granted to any participant
	other than a
	non-employee director during a calendar year under the 2016 Plan may not exceed 1,000,000. The aggregate grant date fair value of all awards granted during any calendar year under the 2016 Plan to any
	non-employee director (other than awards granted at the election of the director in lieu of cash retainers or fees otherwise payable to
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	136
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE COLOR="#5D6E7E">
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>

<A NAME="A2230336ZS-1_HTM_PAGE_DQ46701_1_137">

<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
