	expense was $278 for the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2014 and 2015. Future amortization expenses are expected as follows:

<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	NOTE 3&nbsp;&#151; Notes Payable
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	On August&nbsp;8, 2008, the Company entered into four promissory note agreements with a bank totaling $230 which were used to help fund the Company's relocation to its new corporate headquarters.
	The
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	F-14
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE COLOR="#5D6E7E">
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>

<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	notes
	have interest rates ranging from 2% to the greater of prime plus 1.5% or 7% (7% as of both December&nbsp;31, 2014 and 2015).
</FONT>
</P>

</DIV>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	NOTE 5&nbsp;&#151; Asset Purchase Agreement
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	On September&nbsp;14, 2012, the Company completed an acquisition of certain assets, including inventory, equipment and tooling and patents for the ACTitouch System and a technology known as SMM. The
	purchase price of this acquisition included $3,000 at closing and $2,000 at the earliest of the commercialization date or the first anniversary of the closing date. In addition, the Company is
	required to pay quarterly payments following the commercialization date, which was September&nbsp;1, 2013, through the following sixteen quarterly calculation periods equal to 9% of sales for the
	ACTitouch System and 7% of sales of SMM with a guaranteed minimum amount of $45 for each of the first four quarterly calculation periods (year 1); $148 for each of next four quarterly calculation
	periods (year 2); and $248 for each of the next four quarterly calculation periods (year 3)&nbsp;(total of $1,765). For each quarterly calculation period beginning with the seventeenth quarterly
	calculation period and ending on the tenth anniversary of the commercialization date, the Company will make quarterly payments equal to 6% of the sale of the ACTitouch product and 5% on the sale of
	SMM. If ACTitouch System and SMM sales in any calendar year in years five through ten exceed $40,000, the sales percentage amount shall equal 6% of the sales of product up to $40,000 and 7% on the
	sales of product over $40,000. The Company determined the transaction did not qualify as a purchase of a business acquisition and as such, recorded the transaction as an asset purchase which requires
	the Company to record the transaction at cost, including transaction costs of $285.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	The
	Company allocated the assets acquired as follows:
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY:NONE;*DISPLAY:BLOCK;MARGIN-TOP:-1PT;">

<HR NOSHADE COLOR="#5D6E7E">
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=5,SEQ=187,EFW="2230336",CP="TACTILE SYSTEMS TECHNOLOGY INC.",DN="1",CHK=942245,FOLIO='F-15',FILE='DISK108:[16ZCR1.16ZCR46701]FO46701A.;14',USER='MKEANE',CD='22-NOV-2016;16:06' -->
<A NAME="A2230336ZS-1_HTM_PAGE_FO46701_1_16">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2230336ZS-1_HTM_BG46701A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
<B>
<BR>
	TACTILE SYSTEMS TECHNOLOGY,&nbsp;INC.
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
<B>
	Notes to the Consolidated Financial Statements (Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
<B>
	(in thousands, except percentages and share data)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	NOTE 5&nbsp;&#151; Asset Purchase Agreement (Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	The
	net present value of the guaranteed quarterly minimum payments of $1,765 discounted at 7% (or $1,527) in the first three years from the commercialization date have been included in the acquisition
	price as this portion of the contingent consideration is reasonably estimated and probable. The Company allocated the cost of the technology for the SMM to IPR&amp;D as it does not have an alternative
	future use and requires considerable research and development in the future to bring any potential product to market. This was charged to expense. In addition, the Company recorded a loss on
	impairment of assets acquired of $264 for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2012.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	NOTE 6&nbsp;&#151; Line of Credit&nbsp;&#151; Bank
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	The Company had a $2,000 line of credit with a bank that bore interest at prime (3.25% as of December&nbsp;31, 2014), which expired on May&nbsp;11, 2015. In May 2015, the Company renewed its
	credit line with Venture Bank. This transaction did not result in any debt extinguishment losses or gains. The Company's credit line bears interest based on the prime rate, which was 3.50% as of
	December&nbsp;31, 2015, and expires on May&nbsp;11, 2016. The Company's credit line is secured by substantially all its assets, including property and equipment, accounts receivable and inventory.
	The Company's credit line contains customary conditions to borrowing, events of default and covenants, including covenants that restrict the Company's ability to dispose of assets, merge with or
	acquire other entities, incur indebtedness and encumbrances. In addition, the Company complied with certain financial covenants relating to liquidity and leverage ratios until the renewal in May 2015
	that released the Company from its covenant obligations. There was no outstanding balance on the line of credit as of December&nbsp;31, 2014 or 2015.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	NOTE 7&nbsp;&#151; Commitments and Contingencies
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Lease Obligation
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	In March 2008, the Company entered into a non-cancelable operating lease agreement for building space for its corporate headquarters which provides for
	monthly rent, real estate taxes and operating expenses that expired July&nbsp;31, 2015. In December 2012, the Company extended its lease to July&nbsp;31, 2020. In June 2013, the Company extended
	the lease to July&nbsp;31, 2021. Rent expense was $750 and $866 for the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2014 and 2015, respectively.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	The
	Company also has operating lease agreements for certain computer and office equipment that expire in 2016. The leases provide an option to purchase the related equipment at fair market value at
	the end of the lease.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	F-16
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE COLOR="#5D6E7E">
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
<B>
	(in thousands, except percentages and share data)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>

<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	NOTE 7&nbsp;&#151; Commitments and Contingencies (Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>

<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Major Vendors
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	During the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014, the Company had purchases from one vendor that accounted for 27% of total purchases. The Company had purchases
	from two vendors that accounted for 14% and 13% of total purchases during the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Purchase Commitments
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	The Company issued purchase orders in 2015 totaling $3,658 for inventory that it expected to receive between April and August 2016.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Employment Agreements
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	The Company has entered into employment agreements with certain officers of the Company. The agreements require severance ranging from six to twelve months as
	defined in the agreements for termination without cause. One severance agreement also requires an amount equal to one year of the annual bonus payable for the calendar year preceding the termination
	date as defined in the agreement for termination without cause.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Deferred Compensation
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	Deferred compensation consisted of 47,100 shares of Restricted Series&nbsp;A Preferred Stock as of December&nbsp;31, 2014, and 45,523 as of
	December&nbsp;31, 2015. The restricted shares were valued at $4.23 per share and vest upon a Change in Control as defined in the Restricted Stock Agreements.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	In
	March 2016, the Company's Board of Directors approved the grant of 312,000 stock options and 357,500 restricted stock units. These grants are subject to shareholder approval of a 2016 equity
	incentive plan and the execution of an initial public offering.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Retirement Plan
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	The Company maintains a 401(k) retirement plan for its employees in which eligible employees can contribute a percentage of their compensation. The Company
	may also make discretionary
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	F-17
</FONT>
</P>

<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">

	Table of Contents

</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
<B>
<BR>
	TACTILE SYSTEMS TECHNOLOGY,&nbsp;INC.
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
<B>
	Notes to the Consolidated Financial Statements (Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
<B>
	(in thousands, except percentages and share data)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	NOTE 7&nbsp;&#151; Commitments and Contingencies (Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	contributions.
	The Company made contributions of $82 and $137 for the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2014 and 2015, respectively.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	NOTE 8&nbsp;&#151; Stockholders' Equity
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	In September and October 2012, the Company received gross proceeds of $10,400 for issuance of 2,733,468 shares of its Series&nbsp;B Preferred Stock at $3.80 per share. The Series&nbsp;B Preferred
	Stock included a liquidation preference of the original investment plus an accruing dividend at a rate of 6%, compounded annually, whether or not declared. The accruing dividend was payable upon a
	voluntary or involuntary liquidation or dissolution of the Company, upon conversion of the Series&nbsp;B Preferred
	Stock to common stock, upon redemption of the Series&nbsp;B Preferred Stock or at such time as the Company paid a dividend on other shares of its capital stock. The accruing dividend could be paid
	in cash or, at the option of the stockholder, additional shares of Series&nbsp;B Preferred Stock determined by dividing the amount of the accruing dividend by the Series&nbsp;B Preferred Stock
	purchase price as adjusted. There were $1,494 and $2,199 of undeclared cumulative preferred dividends as of December&nbsp;31, 2014 and 2015, respectively. Holders of shares of Series&nbsp;B
	Preferred Stock were entitled to votes equal to the number of shares of common stock into which such Series&nbsp;B Preferred Stock could be converted. Purchasers of the Series&nbsp;B Preferred
	Stock received anti-dilution rights whereby if the Company issued or sold additional shares of preferred or common shares at a purchase price below $3.80 per share, the Company would issue additional
	shares to these purchasers of Series&nbsp;B Preferred Stock to effectively reduce their purchase price.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	Each
	share of Series&nbsp;B Preferred Stock could be converted into equal shares of common stock at the option of the Series&nbsp;B Preferred Stock holder at any time. In addition, the
	Series&nbsp;B Preferred Stock shares were automatically convertible into common shares upon the sale of shares of common stock to the public at a price per share of at least $11.42 in a firm
	commitment underwritten public offering pursuant to an effective registration statement under the Securities Act of 1933, as amended, resulting in at least $30,000 of proceeds to the Company, net of
	underwriting discounts and commissions and after which the common stock was listed on an United States national securities exchange. Each Series&nbsp;B Preferred stockholder was also entitled to
	receive the number of common shares equal to the Series&nbsp;B Preferred Stock original issue price divided by the initial public offering price per share. In addition, each Series&nbsp;B
	Preferred stockholder was entitled to receive the number of common shares equal to (1)&nbsp;the accrued dividends on the shares of Series&nbsp;B preferred stock divided by the original issue price
	of the Series&nbsp;B preferred stock and (2)&nbsp;the accrued dividends on the shares of Series&nbsp;B preferred stock divided by the initial public offering price per share in the initial
	public offering.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	From
	2007 through 2009, the Company received gross proceeds of $12,950 for the issuance of 3,061,488 shares of its Series&nbsp;A Preferred Stock at $4.23 per share. The Series&nbsp;A Preferred
	Stock included a liquidation preference of the original investment plus an accruing dividend at a rate of 6%, compounded annually, whether or not declared. The accruing dividend was payable upon a
	voluntary or involuntary liquidation or dissolution of the Company or upon conversion of the Series&nbsp;A Preferred Stock to common stock, upon redemption of the Series&nbsp;A Preferred Stock or
	at such time as the Company paid a dividend on other shares of its capital stock. The accruing dividend was to be paid in cash. There were $6,256 and $7,396 of undeclared cumulative preferred
	dividends as of December&nbsp;31,
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	F-18
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE COLOR="#5D6E7E">
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=2,SEQ=190,EFW="2230336",CP="TACTILE SYSTEMS TECHNOLOGY INC.",DN="1",CHK=599496,FOLIO='F-18',FILE='DISK108:[16ZCR1.16ZCR46701]FQ46701A.;11',USER='CMATTI',CD='21-NOV-2016;15:21' -->
<A NAME="A2230336ZS-1_HTM_PAGE_FQ46701_1_19">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2230336ZS-1_HTM_BG46701A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
<B>
<BR>
	TACTILE SYSTEMS TECHNOLOGY,&nbsp;INC.
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
<B>
	Notes to the Consolidated Financial Statements (Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
<B>
	(in thousands, except percentages and share data)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	NOTE 8&nbsp;&#151; Stockholders' Equity (Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	2014
	and 2015, respectively. Holders of shares of Series&nbsp;A Preferred Stock were entitled to votes equal to the number of shares of common stock into which such Series&nbsp;A Preferred Stock
	could be converted. Purchasers of the Series&nbsp;A Preferred Stock received anti-dilution rights whereby if the Company issued or sold additional shares of preferred or common shares at a purchase
	price below $4.23 per share, the Company would issue additional shares to these purchasers of Series&nbsp;A Preferred Stock to effectively reduce their purchase price. The Series&nbsp;B Preferred
	Stock was sold at a price less than the Series&nbsp;A
	Preferred Stock. As a result, the Company issued 83,972 shares of Common Stock for this anti-dilution provision once the initial public offering was declared.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	Each
	share of Series&nbsp;A Preferred Stock could be converted into equal shares of common stock at the option of the Series&nbsp;A Preferred Stock holder at any time. In addition, the
	Series&nbsp;A Preferred Stock shares were automatically convertible into common shares upon the sale of shares of common stock to the public at a minimum price of $11.42 per share in a firm
	commitment underwritten public offering pursuant to an effective registration statement under the Securities Act of 1933, as amended, resulting in at least $30,000 of proceeds to the Company, net of
	underwriting discounts and commissions. Each Series&nbsp;A Preferred stockholder was also entitled to receive the number of common shares equal to the Series&nbsp;A Preferred Stock original issue
	price divided by the initial public offering price per share.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	All
	shares of preferred stock were to be redeemed by the Company in either a lump sum or three equal annual installments any time after the Company received notice from one of its two largest
	preferred stockholders after September&nbsp;14, 2017. Each share of preferred stock would be repurchased at its purchase price, as adjusted, plus all unpaid accruing dividends. The Company recorded
	its convertible preferred stock at fair value on the dates of issuance, net of issuance costs. As the redemption event was outside the control of the Company, all shares of convertible preferred stock
	were presented outside of permanent equity. The Company elected to recognize changes in the redemption value immediately as they occurred and adjusted the carrying amount of the convertible preferred
	stock to equal the redemption value at the end of each reporting period.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	At
	the time of its issuance, the Company determined that the Series&nbsp;B and Series&nbsp;A preferred stock contained two embedded features: (1)&nbsp;optional redemption by the holder and
	(2)&nbsp;optional conversion by the holder. The Company determined that each of the embedded features met the definition of a derivative and that the Series&nbsp;B and Series&nbsp;A preferred
	stock should be considered an equity host for the purposes of assessing the embedded derivatives for potential bifurcation. The following was noted regarding these embedded features:
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
<I>
	Optional Redemption by the Holder.
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Company determined that the redemption feature was not clearly and closely related to the equity host instrument
	but did not
	meet the definition of a derivative. As such, the redemption feature did not require bifurcation under the guidance for derivatives.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
<I>
	Optional Conversion by the Holder.
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The optional conversion feature was determined to be clearly and closely related to the Series&nbsp;B and
	Series&nbsp;A
	preferred stock host. As such the conversion feature did not require bifurcation under ASC 815.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	F-19
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE COLOR="#5D6E7E">
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=3,SEQ=191,EFW="2230336",CP="TACTILE SYSTEMS TECHNOLOGY INC.",DN="1",CHK=1038554,FOLIO='F-19',FILE='DISK108:[16ZCR1.16ZCR46701]FQ46701A.;11',USER='CMATTI',CD='21-NOV-2016;15:21' -->
<A NAME="A2230336ZS-1_HTM_PAGE_FQ46701_1_20">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">

<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	The
	Series&nbsp;B and Series&nbsp;A preferred stock was assessed under ASC 470, "Debt," to determine if there was a beneficial conversion feature, or BCF. The Company determined there was no BCF.
</FONT>
</P>

<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Stock Option Plans
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	During 2003, the Company adopted the 2003 Plan, pursuant to which stock options to acquire an aggregate of 248,223 shares of the Company's common stock may be
	granted to employees, directors and consultants. In 2003, in connection with the adoption of the 2003 Stock Option Plan (the "2003 Plan"), the board of directors decided they would no longer grant any
	options under the 2001 Plan. On March&nbsp;31, 2005, the Company increased the number of authorized shares to 496,446 shares. In September 2006, the Company increased the number of authorized shares
	to 638,288 shares. In general, options vest over a four-year period and expire five to ten years from the date of grant.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	During
	2007, the Company adopted the 2007 Omnibus Stock Option Plan (the "2007 Plan") pursuant to which stock options to acquire an aggregate of 567,367 shares of the Company's common stock may be
	granted to employees, directors, and consultants. In October 2008, the Company increased the number of authorized shares to 1,010,622. In March 2011, the Company increased the number of authorized
	shares to 1,719,831. In September 2012, the Company increased the number of authorized shares to 2,304,928. In October 2014, the Company increased the number of authorized shares to 2,429,039. In
	February 2015, the Company increased the number of authorized shares to 2,553,151. With the adoption of the 2007 Plan, the board of directors decided the Company would no longer grant any options
	under the 2003 Plan. In general, options granted under the 2007 Plan vest over a four-year period and expire ten years from the date of grant. The Company issues new shares upon the exercise of
	options.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	F-20
</FONT>
</P>

</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	Deferred
	income taxes result from temporary differences between the reporting of amounts for financial statement purposes and income tax purposes. These differences relate primarily to different
	methods used for income tax purposes including depreciation and amortization, vacation accruals, deductions related to allowances for doubtful accounts, and net operating loss carryforwards.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	F-23
</FONT>
</P>

</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	The
	Company adjusted its deferred tax assets by $297 for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 related to a reduction in the state income tax rate used to calculate its deferred tax assets.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	The
	Company recognizes the financial statement benefit of a tax position only after determining that the relevant tax authority would more likely than not sustain the position following an audit. For
	tax positions meeting the more likely than not threshold, the amount recognized in the consolidated financial statements is the largest benefit that has a greater than 50% likelihood of being realized
	upon ultimate settlement with the relevant tax authority.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	With
	few exceptions, the Company is no longer subject to U.S. federal, state or local income tax examinations by tax authorities for the years before 2011. The Company is not currently under
	examination by any taxing jurisdiction. In the event of any future tax assessments, the Company has elected to record the income taxes and any related interest and penalties as income tax expense on
	the Company's statement of operations.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	F-24
</FONT>
</P>

<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	NOTE 11&nbsp;&#151; Subsequent Events
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	For the audited consolidated financial statements, management reviewed and evaluated material subsequent events from the consolidated balance sheet date of December&nbsp;31, 2015, through the
	consolidated financial statements' issue date of March&nbsp;25, 2016. No subsequent events were identified for disclosure except as disclosed.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	In
	connection with the initial public offering, the Company's board of directors approved a reverse stock split of the Company's common stock on a 1-for-2.820044 basis. The reverse stock split was
	approved and became effective on June&nbsp;8, 2016. The par value of the common stock was not adjusted as a result of the reverse stock split. Accordingly, all shares and per share amounts for all
	periods presented in these consolidated financial statements and notes thereto have been adjusted retroactively, where applicable, to reflect the reverse stock split.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	F-25
</FONT>
</P>

<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>

<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2230336ZS-1_HTM_BG46701A_MAIN_TOC">

<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
<A NAME="A2230336ZS-1_HTM_GC">
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
<B>
<BR>
	TACTILE SYSTEMS TECHNOLOGY,&nbsp;INC.
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
<B>
	Notes to the Condensed Consolidated Financial Statements
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
<B>
	(Unaudited)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	NOTE 1&nbsp;&#151; Nature of Operations and Basis of Presentation
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Nature of Operations
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	Tactile Systems Technology,&nbsp;Inc. ("we," "us," and "our") is the sole manufacturer and distributor of the Flexitouch and Entr&eacute; Systems,
	medical devices that help control symptoms of lymphedema, a chronic and progressive medical condition that is often an unintended consequence of cancer treatment, and the ACTitouch System, a medical
	device used to treat venous leg&nbsp;ulcers and chronic venous insufficiency. We provide our products for use in the home and sell them through vascular, wound and lymphedema clinics throughout the
	United States. We do business as "Tactile Medical."
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Basis of Presentation
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	Our accompanying unaudited condensed consolidated financial statements have been prepared in accordance with accounting principles generally accepted in the
	United States ("GAAP") for interim financial reporting and pursuant to the rules and regulations of the SEC. Accordingly, they do not include all of the information and footnotes required by GAAP for
	complete financial statements. In the opinion of management, all adjustments (including those which are normal and recurring) considered necessary for a fair presentation of the interim financial
	information have been included. The results for the nine months ended September&nbsp;30, 2016 are not necessarily indicative of results to be expected for the year ending December&nbsp;31, 2016,
	or for any other interim period or for any future year. Our business is affected by seasonality. In the first quarter of each year, when most
	patients have started a new insurance year and have not paid their annual deductibles, we experience substantially reduced demand for our products. We typically experience higher sales in the third
	and fourth quarters as a result of patients having paid their annual insurance deductibles in full, thereby reducing their out-of-pocket costs for our products, or because patients often spend the
	remaining balances in their flexible spending accounts. The condensed consolidated interim financial statements should be read in conjunction with the audited financial statements and notes thereto
	included elsewhere in this prospectus.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	We
	were originally incorporated in Minnesota under the name Tactile Systems Technology,&nbsp;Inc. on January&nbsp;30, 1995. During 2006, we established a merger corporation and subsequently, on
	July&nbsp;21, 2006, merged with and into this merger corporation. The resulting corporation assumed the name Tactile Systems Technology,&nbsp;Inc. The purpose of this merger was to reincorporate
	the company in Delaware, increase the number of authorized common shares to 8.9&nbsp;million and assign a par value of $0.001 to our common stock. In September 2013, we began doing business as
	"Tactile Medical."
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	In
	connection with preparing for our initial public offering, our board of directors and stockholders approved a one-for-2.820044 reverse stock split of our capital stock. The reverse stock split
	became effective in June 2016. All share and per share amounts in these financial statements and notes thereto have been retroactively adjusted for all periods presented to give effect to this reverse
	stock split, including reclassifying an amount equal to the reduction in par value of common stock to additional paid-in capital.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	On
	August&nbsp;2, 2016 we closed the initial public offering of our common stock, which resulted in the sale of 4,120,000 shares of our common stock at a public offering price of $10.00 per share.
	We received net proceeds from the initial public offering of approximately $35.4&nbsp;million, after deducting
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	F-30
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE COLOR="#5D6E7E">
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>

<A NAME="A2230336ZS-1_HTM_PAGE_GC46701_1_31">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">

<A HREF="#A2230336ZS-1_HTM_BG46701A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
<B>
<BR>
	TACTILE SYSTEMS TECHNOLOGY,&nbsp;INC.
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
<B>
	Notes to the Condensed Consolidated Financial Statements (Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
<B>
	(Unaudited)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	NOTE 1&nbsp;&#151; Nature of Operations and Basis of Presentation (Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	underwriting
	discounts and approximately $2.9&nbsp;million of transaction expenses. In connection with the closing of the initial public offering, all of our outstanding redeemable convertible
	preferred stock automatically converted to common stock on August&nbsp;2, 2016. At August&nbsp;2, 2016, we did not have any redeemable convertible preferred stock issued or outstanding. The
	significant increase in common stock outstanding in connection with the initial public offering is expected to impact the year-over-year comparability of our earnings per share calculations in future
	periods.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Basis of Consolidation
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	The condensed consolidated financial statements include the accounts of Tactile Systems Technology,&nbsp;Inc. and its wholly owned subsidiary, Swelling
	Solutions,&nbsp;Inc., after elimination of intercompany accounts and transactions.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	JOBS Act Accounting Election
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	As an emerging growth company under the Jumpstart Our Business Startups ("JOBS") Act, we are eligible to take advantage of certain exemptions from various
	reporting requirements that are applicable to other public companies that are not emerging growth companies. We have elected to take advantage of the extended transition period for adopting new or
	revised accounting standards that have different effective dates for public and private companies until such time as those standards apply to private companies.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Estimates
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	The preparation of the condensed consolidated financial statements in conformity with GAAP requires management to make estimates and assumptions that affect
	the reported amounts of assets and liabilities and disclosure of contingent assets and liabilities at the date of the condensed consolidated financial statements and the reported amounts of revenues
	and expenses during the reporting period. Actual results could differ from those estimates. We continue to refine our estimates of the Medicare and other accounts receivable and related revenue
	recognition based on information available to us related to historical approval rates.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Significant Accounting Policies
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	During the nine months ended September&nbsp;30, 2016 there were no material changes in our significant accounting policies. See Note&nbsp;1 to the
	condensed consolidated financial
	statements included elsewhere in this prospectus, for information regarding our significant accounting policies.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Recent Accounting Pronouncements
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	In May 2014, the Financial Accounting Standards Board ("FASB") issued guidance creating Accounting Standards Codification ("ASC") Section&nbsp;606, "Revenue
	from Contracts with Customers." The new section will replace Section&nbsp;605, "Revenue Recognition," and creates modifications to various other revenue accounting standards for specialized
	transactions and industries. The section is intended to conform revenue accounting principles with a concurrently issued International Financial Reporting Standards to reconcile previously differing
	treatment between United States practices and those of the
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	F-31
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE COLOR="#5D6E7E">
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=2,SEQ=203,EFW="2230336",CP="TACTILE SYSTEMS TECHNOLOGY INC.",DN="1",CHK=873551,FOLIO='F-31',FILE='DISK108:[16ZCR1.16ZCR46701]GC46701A.;11',USER='CMATTI',CD='21-NOV-2016;15:22' -->
<A NAME="A2230336ZS-1_HTM_PAGE_GC46701_1_32">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>

	Table of Contents

<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
<B>

	TACTILE SYSTEMS TECHNOLOGY,&nbsp;INC.

<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
<B>
	Notes to the Condensed Consolidated Financial Statements (Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
<B>
	(Unaudited)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	NOTE 1&nbsp;&#151; Nature of Operations and Basis of Presentation (Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	rest
	of the world and to enhance disclosures related to disaggregated revenue information. The updated guidance, which was amended July&nbsp;9, 2015, is effective for annual reporting periods
	beginning on or after December&nbsp;15, 2017, and interim periods within those annual periods. We will adopt the new provisions of this accounting standard at the beginning of fiscal year 2018,
	because early adoption is not allowed. We are currently evaluating the impact of this new standard on our consolidated financial statements.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	In
	November 2015, the FASB issued Accounting Standards Update ("ASU") 2015-l7, "Income Taxes: Balance Sheet Classification of Deferred Taxes," which requires entities to present deferred tax assets
	and deferred tax liabilities as noncurrent in a classified balance sheet. The ASU is effective for annual periods beginning after December&nbsp;15, 20l7, and interim periods within annual periods
	beginning after December&nbsp;15, 2018. Early adoption is permitted for all entities. We are currently evaluating the impact of this new standard on our consolidated financial statements.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	In
	February 2016, the FASB issued ASU 2016-02, "Leases" (Topic 842), which supersedes the existing guidance for lease accounting, "Leases" (Topic 840). ASU 2016-02 requires lessees to recognize a
	lease liability and a right of use asset for all leases. Lessor accounting remains largely unchanged. The amendments in this ASU are effective for fiscal years beginning after December&nbsp;15, 2018
	and interim periods within those fiscal years. Early adoption is permitted for all entities. ASU 2016-02 requires a modified retrospective approach for all leases existing at or entered into after the
	date of initial adoption, with an option to elect to use certain transition relief. We are currently evaluating the impact of this new standard on our consolidated financial statements.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	In
	March 2016, the FASB issued ASU 2016-09, "Improvements to Employee Share-Based Payment Accounting," which simplifies several aspects of the accounting for employee share-based payment transactions,
	including the accounting for income taxes and statutory tax withholding requirements and classification within the statement of cash flows. The ASU is effective for fiscal years beginning after
	December&nbsp;15, 2016. We are currently evaluating the impact of this new standard on our consolidated financial statements.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	In
	June 2016, the FASB issued ASU No.&nbsp;2016-13, "Financial Instruments&nbsp;&#151; Credit Losses," to require the measurement of expected credit losses for financial instruments held at
	the reporting date based on historical experience, current conditions and reasonable forecasts. The ASU is effective for fiscal years beginning after December&nbsp;15, 2019, including interim
	periods within those fiscal years. We are currently evaluating the impact of this new standard on our consolidated financial statements.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	In
	August 2016, the FASB issued ASU No.&nbsp;2016-15, "Statement of Cash Flows (Topic 230)&nbsp;&#151; Classification of Certain Cash Receipts and Cash Payments," to provide clarity on how
	certain cash receipt and cash payment transactions are presented and classified within the statement of cash flows. The ASU is effective for fiscal years beginning after December&nbsp;15, 2017,
	including interim periods within those fiscal years. We are currently evaluating the impact of this new standard on our consolidated financial statements.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	F-32
</FONT>
</P>

<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">

	or less at the time of purchase. At September&nbsp;30, 2016, our cash was held primarily in checking and money market accounts.
</FONT>

<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	Amortization
	expense was $0.2&nbsp;million for the nine-month periods ended September&nbsp;30, 2016 and September&nbsp;30, 2015, and $0.1&nbsp;million for the three-month periods ended
	September&nbsp;30, 2016 and September&nbsp;30, 2015. Future amortization expenses are expected as follows:
</FONT>

<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	NOTE 4&nbsp;&#151; Line of Credit&nbsp;&#151; Bank
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	We have a $2.0&nbsp;million line of credit with a bank that bears interest based on the prime rate, which was 3.50% as of September&nbsp;30, 2016, and expires on May&nbsp;11, 2017. Our credit
	line is secured by
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	F-33
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE COLOR="#5D6E7E">
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=4,SEQ=205,EFW="2230336",CP="TACTILE SYSTEMS TECHNOLOGY INC.",DN="1",CHK=592697,FOLIO='F-33',FILE='DISK108:[16ZCR1.16ZCR46701]GC46701A.;11',USER='CMATTI',CD='21-NOV-2016;15:22' -->
<A NAME="A2230336ZS-1_HTM_PAGE_GC46701_1_34">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2230336ZS-1_HTM_BG46701A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
<B>
<BR>
	TACTILE SYSTEMS TECHNOLOGY,&nbsp;INC.
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
<B>
	Notes to the Condensed Consolidated Financial Statements (Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
<B>
	(Unaudited)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	NOTE 4&nbsp;&#151; Line of Credit&nbsp;&#151; Bank (Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	substantially
	all of our assets, including property and equipment, accounts receivable and inventory. Our credit line contains customary conditions as to borrowing, events of default and covenants,
	including covenants that restrict our ability to dispose of assets, merge with or acquire other entities, and incur indebtedness or encumbrances. There was no outstanding balance on the line of credit
	as of September&nbsp;30, 2016 or as of December&nbsp;31, 2015.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	NOTE 5&nbsp;&#151; Commitments and Contingencies
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Lease Obligations
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	In March 2008, we entered into a non-cancelable operating lease agreement for building space for our corporate headquarters that provides for monthly rent,
	real estate taxes and operating expenses that was extended to July&nbsp;31, 2021. Rent expense was $0.6&nbsp;million for both the nine-month periods ended September&nbsp;30, 2016 and
	September&nbsp;30, 2015, and $0.2&nbsp;million for both the three-month periods ended September&nbsp;30, 2016 and September&nbsp;30, 2015.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	In
	July 2016, we entered into a non-cancelable operating lease agreement for building space to accommodate the relocation of our manufacturing, quality, and research and development functions. The
	lease agreement extends through October 2021 and provides for monthly rent, real estate taxes and operating expenses. Because we did not take possession of this leased facility prior to
	September&nbsp;30, 2016, no associated rent expense has been recorded in our statement of operations as of September&nbsp;30, 2016.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	We
	also have operating lease agreements for certain computer and office equipment that expire in 2020. The leases provide an option to purchase the related equipment at fair market value at the end of
	the lease.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	Future
	base minimum lease payments for all lease obligations are expected to be as follows for the years ending December&nbsp;31:
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY:NONE;*DISPLAY:BLOCK;MARGIN-TOP:-1PT;">
</DIV>

<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Major Vendors
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	We had purchases from three vendors that accounted for 36% and 45% of total purchases for the nine-month periods ended September&nbsp;30, 2016 and
	September&nbsp;30, 2015, respectively, and 35% of total purchases for each of the three-month periods ended September&nbsp;30, 2016 and September&nbsp;30, 2015.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	F-34
</FONT>
</P>

	Table of Contents

</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
<B>
<BR>
	TACTILE SYSTEMS TECHNOLOGY,&nbsp;INC.
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
<B>
	Notes to the Condensed Consolidated Financial Statements (Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
<B>
	(Unaudited)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	NOTE 5&nbsp;&#151; Commitments and Contingencies (Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Purchase Commitment
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	We issued purchase orders in February 2016 totaling $7.6&nbsp;million for inventory that we expect to receive between October 2016 and July 2017.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Employment Agreements
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	We have entered into employment agreements with certain of our officers. The agreements provide for payment of severance ranging from nine to 15&nbsp;months
	of then-current annualized base salary in the event of termination by us without cause or by the employee for good reason or, in the case of two of the officers, death, disability, or as a result of a
	qualifying termination after a change in control. The agreements also provide for payment of an amount equal to nine to 15&nbsp;months of the then-current annual target bonus in the event of
	termination by us without cause or by the employee for good reason, or, in the case of two of the officers, death, disability, or as a result of a qualifying termination after a change in control. In
	addition, the agreements provide for the vesting of certain equity compensation through the date of termination in the event of termination by us without cause or by the employee for good reason.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Deferred Compensation
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	Deferred compensation consisted of 66,010 shares of restricted common stock as of September&nbsp;30, 2016. These shares of restricted common stock were
	issued upon the conversion of 45,523 shares of restricted Series&nbsp;A preferred stock outstanding immediately prior to the completion of our initial public offering. The restricted shares vest
	upon the earlier of a change in control, as defined in the restricted stock agreement, or May&nbsp;2, 2017.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Retirement Plan
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	We maintain a 401(k) retirement plan for our employees in which eligible employees can contribute a percentage of their pre-tax compensation. We may also make
	discretionary contributions to the 401(k) plan. We made contributions of $120,000 and $100,000 for the nine-month periods ended September&nbsp;30, 2016 and September&nbsp;30, 2015, respectively,
	and $45,000 and $36,000 for the three-month periods ended September&nbsp;30, 2016 and September&nbsp;30, 2015, respectively.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	NOTE 6&nbsp;&#151; Stockholders' Equity
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	In September and October 2012, we received gross proceeds of $10.4&nbsp;million for issuance of 2,733,468 shares of our Series&nbsp;B preferred stock at $3.80 per share. The Series&nbsp;B
	preferred stock included a liquidation preference of the original investment plus an accruing dividend at a rate of 6%, compounded annually, whether or not declared. The accruing dividend was payable
	upon a voluntary or involuntary liquidation or dissolution of our company, upon conversion of the Series&nbsp;B preferred
	stock to common stock, upon redemption of the Series&nbsp;B preferred stock or at such time as we paid a dividend on other shares of our capital stock. The accruing dividend could have been paid in
	cash or, at the option of the stockholder, additional shares of Series&nbsp;B preferred stock determined by dividing the amount of the accruing dividend by the Series&nbsp;B preferred stock
	purchase price as adjusted. There were $2.6&nbsp;million of undeclared cumulative preferred dividends as of August&nbsp;2, 2016, the date we
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	F-35
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE COLOR="#5D6E7E">
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=1,SEQ=207,EFW="2230336",CP="TACTILE SYSTEMS TECHNOLOGY INC.",DN="1",CHK=359110,FOLIO='F-35',FILE='DISK108:[16ZCR1.16ZCR46701]GE46701A.;13',USER='CMATTI',CD='21-NOV-2016;15:22' -->
<A NAME="A2230336ZS-1_HTM_PAGE_GE46701_1_36">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2230336ZS-1_HTM_BG46701A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
<B>
<BR>
	TACTILE SYSTEMS TECHNOLOGY,&nbsp;INC.
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
<B>
	Notes to the Condensed Consolidated Financial Statements (Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
<B>
	(Unaudited)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	NOTE 6&nbsp;&#151; Stockholders' Equity (Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	closed
	our initial public offering and paid those dividends in the form of shares of our common stock. Holders of shares of Series&nbsp;B preferred stock were entitled to votes equal to the number
	of shares of common stock into which such Series&nbsp;B preferred stock could be converted.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	Each
	share of Series&nbsp;B preferred stock could be converted into equal shares of common stock at the option of the Series&nbsp;B preferred stock holder at any time. In addition, the
	Series&nbsp;B preferred stock shares were automatically convertible into common shares upon the sale of shares of common stock to the public at a price per share of at least $11.42 in a firm
	commitment underwritten public offering pursuant to an effective registration statement under the Securities Act of 1933, as amended, resulting in at least $30&nbsp;million of proceeds to our
	company, net of underwriting discounts and commissions and after which the common stock is listed on an United States national securities exchange. Each Series&nbsp;B Preferred stockholder was also
	entitled to receive the number of common shares equal to the Series&nbsp;B preferred stock original issue price divided by the initial public offering price per share. In addition, each
	Series&nbsp;B Preferred stockholder was entitled to receive the number of common shares equal to (1)&nbsp;the accrued dividends on the shares of Series&nbsp;B preferred stock divided by the
	original issue price of the Series&nbsp;B preferred stock and (2)&nbsp;the accrued dividends on the shares of Series&nbsp;B preferred stock divided by the initial public offering price per share
	in the offering.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	From
	2007 through 2009, we received gross proceeds of $13.0&nbsp;million for the issuance of 3,061,488 shares of our Series&nbsp;A preferred stock at $4.23 per share. The Series&nbsp;A preferred
	stock included a liquidation preference of the original investment plus an accruing dividend at a rate of 6%, compounded annually, whether or not declared. The accruing dividend was payable upon a
	voluntary or involuntary liquidation or dissolution of our company or upon conversion of the Series&nbsp;A preferred stock to common stock, upon redemption of the Series&nbsp;A preferred stock or
	at such time as we paid a dividend on other shares of our capital stock. The accruing dividend would be paid in cash. There were $8.2&nbsp;million of undeclared cumulative preferred dividends as of
	August&nbsp;2, 2016, the date we closed our initial public offering and paid those dividends in cash. Holders of shares of Series&nbsp;A preferred stock were entitled to votes equal to the number
	of shares of common stock into which such Series&nbsp;A preferred stock could be converted. Purchasers of the Series&nbsp;A preferred stock received anti-dilution rights whereby if we issued or
	sold additional shares of preferred or common shares at a purchase price below $4.23 per share, we would issue additional shares to these purchasers of Series&nbsp;A preferred stock to effectively
	reduce their purchase price. The Series&nbsp;B preferred stock was sold at a price less than the Series&nbsp;A preferred stock. As a result, we issued 83,972 shares of common stock for this
	anti-dilution provision.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	Each
	share of Series&nbsp;A preferred stock could be converted into equal shares of common stock at the option of the Series&nbsp;A preferred stock holder at any time. In addition, the
	Series&nbsp;A preferred stock shares were automatically convertible into common shares upon the sale of shares of common stock to the public at a minimum price of $11.42 per share in a firm
	commitment underwritten public offering pursuant to an effective registration statement under the Securities Act of 1933, as amended, resulting in at least $30&nbsp;million of proceeds to our
	company, net of underwriting discounts and commissions. Each Series&nbsp;A Preferred stockholder was also entitled to receive the number of common shares equal to the Series&nbsp;A preferred stock
	original issue price divided by the initial public offering price per share.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	F-36
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE COLOR="#5D6E7E">
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=2,SEQ=208,EFW="2230336",CP="TACTILE SYSTEMS TECHNOLOGY INC.",DN="1",CHK=134119,FOLIO='F-36',FILE='DISK108:[16ZCR1.16ZCR46701]GE46701A.;13',USER='CMATTI',CD='21-NOV-2016;15:22' -->
<A NAME="A2230336ZS-1_HTM_PAGE_GE46701_1_37">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2230336ZS-1_HTM_BG46701A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
<B>
<BR>
	TACTILE SYSTEMS TECHNOLOGY,&nbsp;INC.
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
<B>
	Notes to the Condensed Consolidated Financial Statements (Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
<B>
	(Unaudited)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	NOTE 6&nbsp;&#151; Stockholders' Equity (Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	At
	the time of its issuance, we determined that the Series&nbsp;B and Series&nbsp;A preferred stock contained two embedded features: (1)&nbsp;optional redemption by the holder and
	(2)&nbsp;optional conversion by the holder. We determined that each of the embedded features met the definition of a derivative and that the Series&nbsp;B and Series&nbsp;A preferred stock
	should be considered an equity host for the purposes of assessing the embedded derivatives for potential bifurcation. The following was noted regarding these embedded features:
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
<I>
	Optional Redemption by the Holder.
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;We determined that the redemption feature was not clearly and closely related to the equity host instrument but does
	not meet
	the definition of a derivative. As such, the redemption feature did not require bifurcation under the guidance for derivatives.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
<I>
	Optional Conversion by the Holder.
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The optional conversion feature was determined to be clearly and closely related to the Series&nbsp;B and
	Series&nbsp;A
	preferred stock host. As such the conversion feature did not require bifurcation under ASC 815-"Derivatives and Hedging".
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	The
	Series&nbsp;B and Series&nbsp;A preferred stock was assessed under ASC 470, "Debt," to determine if there was a beneficial conversion feature. We determined there was no beneficial conversion
	feature.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	We
	completed the initial public offering of our common stock on August&nbsp;2, 2016, in which we sold 4,120,000 shares of our common stock at a public offering price of $10.00 per share. Immediately
	prior to the completion of the initial public offering, all then-outstanding shares of our Series&nbsp;A and Series&nbsp;B preferred stock were converted into 5,924,453 shares of our common stock.
	Our Series&nbsp;A preferred stock converted to common stock at a ratio of 1-for-1.03 and our Series&nbsp;B preferred stock
	converted to common stock at a ratio of 1-for-1. In addition, immediately prior to the completion of the initial public offering, we issued 2,354,323 additional shares of our common stock that our
	Series&nbsp;A and Series&nbsp;B preferred stockholders were entitled to receive in connection with the conversion of the preferred stock, and we issued 956,842 shares of our common stock to pay
	accrued dividends on our Series&nbsp;B preferred stock. We also paid $8.2&nbsp;million in cumulative accrued dividends to our Series&nbsp;A convertible preferred stockholders in connection with
	the initial public offering, including $0.1&nbsp;million of dividends paid to the holders of the common restricted shares.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Stock-Based Compensation
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	Our equity compensation plans provide for the grant of incentive and nonqualified stock options, as well as other stock-based awards, including restricted
	stock and restricted stock units, to employees, non-employee directors and other consultants who provide services to us. Restricted stock awards result in the issuance of new shares when granted. For
	other stock-based awards, new shares are issued when the award is exercised, vested or released according to the terms of the agreement.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	In
	June 2016, we adopted the 2016 Equity Incentive Plan (the "2016 Plan"), pursuant to which an aggregate of 4.8&nbsp;million shares of our common stock may be awarded to employees, directors and
	consultants as equity awards in the form of stock grants, restricted stock awards, stock options, restricted stock units, performance shares and other equity awards. With the adoption of the 2016
	Plan, the board of directors decided we would no longer grant any options under our other existing
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	F-37
</FONT>
</P>

<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	Of
	the total outstanding options at September&nbsp;30, 2016, 1,283,036 were exercisable with a weighted average exercise price of $1.02 per share. The total outstanding options had a weighted
	average remaining contractual life of 5.7&nbsp;years.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	At
	September&nbsp;30, 2016, there was approximately $2.0&nbsp;million of unrecognized stock option expense under our equity compensation plans, which is expected to be recognized on a
	straight-line basis over a weighted average period of 2.7&nbsp;years.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Restricted Stock Units
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	In conjunction with our initial public offering, we granted 307,594 restricted stock units ("RSUs") under the 2016 Plan to executives, other employees and
	non-employee directors, which RSUs had an
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	F-38
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE COLOR="#5D6E7E">
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>

<A NAME="A2230336ZS-1_HTM_PAGE_GE46701_1_39">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2230336ZS-1_HTM_BG46701A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
<B>
<BR>
	TACTILE SYSTEMS TECHNOLOGY,&nbsp;INC.
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
<B>
	Notes to the Condensed Consolidated Financial Statements (Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
<B>
	(Unaudited)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	NOTE 6&nbsp;&#151; Stockholders' Equity (Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	aggregate
	grant date fair value of $3.1&nbsp;million. These RSUs include only a time-based service condition. The compensation expense of these RSUs was determined using the fair value of the
	company's common stock on the date of grant, and compensation expense will be recognized on a straight-line basis over the requisite vesting period. At September&nbsp;30, 2016, there was
	$2.9&nbsp;million of total unrecognized compensation expense related to these unvested RSUs, which is expected be recognized over a weighted average period of 2.5&nbsp;years.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Employee Stock Purchase Plan
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	Our employee stock purchase plan ("ESPP"), which was approved by our board of directors on April&nbsp;27, 2016 and by our stockholders on June&nbsp;20,
	2016, allows participating employees to purchase shares of our common stock at a discount through payroll deductions. The plan is available to all of our employees and employees of participating
	subsidiaries. Participating employees may purchase common stock, on a voluntary after tax-basis, at a price equal to 85% of the lower of the closing market price per share of our common stock on the
	first or last trading day of each stock purchase period. The plan ordinarily consists of six-month purchase periods, beginning on May&nbsp;16 and November&nbsp;16 of each calendar year, but the
	initial purchase period began on July&nbsp;27, 2016 and will end on May&nbsp;15, 2017. A total of 1.6&nbsp;million shares of common stock are reserved for issuance under the plan, and this share
	reserve will automatically be supplemented each January&nbsp;1 through the year 2026 by an amount equal to the least of (1)&nbsp;1% of the shares of our common stock outstanding on the immediately
	preceding December&nbsp;31, (2)&nbsp;500,000 shares or (3)&nbsp;such lesser amount as our board of directors may determine. No purchases were made under the plan in the nine months ended
	September&nbsp;30, 2016. We recognized $0.2&nbsp;million in stock-based compensation expense related to the ESPP for each of the three-month and nine-month periods ended September&nbsp;30, 2016.
	We did not recognize any stock-based compensation expense related to the ESPP in either of the three-month or nine-month periods ended September&nbsp;30, 2015.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	NOTE 7&nbsp;&#151; Income Taxes
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	We record our interim provision for income taxes by applying our estimated annual effective tax rate to our year-to-date pre-tax income and adjust the provision for discrete tax items recorded in the
	period. Deferred income taxes result from temporary differences between the reporting of amounts for financial statement purposes and income tax purposes. These differences relate primarily to
	different methods used for income tax purposes including depreciation and amortization, warranty and vacation accruals, and deductions related to allowances for doubtful accounts receivable and
	inventory reserves.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	We
	recorded income tax expense of $0.5&nbsp;million for the three-month and nine-month periods ended September&nbsp;30, 2016, respectively. We recorded income tax expense of $0.6&nbsp;million
	and $0.1&nbsp;million for the three-month and nine-month periods ended September&nbsp;30, 2015, respectively. Our provisions for income taxes included current federal and state income tax expense,
	as well as deferred federal and state income tax expense.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	We
	recognize the financial statement benefit of a tax position only after determining that the relevant tax authority would more likely than not sustain the position following an audit. For tax
	positions meeting the more likely than not threshold, the amount recognized in the condensed consolidated
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	F-39
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE COLOR="#5D6E7E">
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>

	financial
	statements is the largest benefit that has a greater than 50% likelihood of being realized upon ultimate settlement with the relevant tax authority.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	With
	few exceptions, we are no longer subject to U.S. federal, state or local income tax examinations by tax authorities for the years before 2011. We are not currently under examination by any taxing
	jurisdiction. In the event of any future tax assessments, we have elected to record the income taxes and any related interest and penalties as income tax expense on our statement of operations.
</FONT>

<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">

	As
	of September&nbsp;30, 2016, total common shares outstanding and the potentially dilutive shares totaled approximately 18.5&nbsp;million shares.

<EFX_OFFERING_EXPENSE>
<A NAME="FIS_OFFERING_EXPENSE"></A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
<A NAME="A2230336ZS-1_HTM_JA46701_ITEM_13__OTHER_EXPENSE__JA401991">
</A>
<A NAME="A2230336ZS-1_HTM_TOC_JA46701_2">
</A>
</FONT>
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
<B>
	Item&nbsp;13.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Other Expenses of Issuance and Distribution.
<BR>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT COLOR="#5D6E7E" SIZE=2>
	The following table sets forth the costs and expenses, other than the underwriting discounts and commissions, payable by us in connection with the sale of
	common stock being registered. All amounts shown are estimates, except the SEC registration fee, the Financial Industry Regulatory Authority,&nbsp;Inc. filing fee and stock exchange listing fee.
</FONT>
</P>
